original: de ltar na dbyibs ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi khongs su @180a * //
analyzed: de ltar na dbyibs ni gzugs kyi skye mched kyi khongs su @180a * //
translated: Thus shape is included in the form base.üîΩ

original: 'du la / lci ba nyid la sogs pa rnams ni reg bya'i skye mched kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ha cang nyung ba dang ha cang mang bar smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du la / lci ba nyid la sogs pa rnams ni reg bya'i skye mched kyi khongs su 'du ba'i phyir ha cang nyung ba dang ha cang mang bar smras pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, shape is included in the form base, and heaviness, etc. are included in the tangible base. Therefore, it is not the case that the elements are either too few or too many.

original: gal te rten du gyur pa rjes su bzung ba de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid las mi grol lo //
analyzed: gal te rten du gyur pa rjes su bzung ba de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid las mi grol lo //
translated: Even if the elements are accepted as the support, the objection still remains that the elements are not ascertained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na kha dog sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams so sor 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na kha dog sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs rnams so sor 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because color, etc., which are derivative form, arise in dependence on a collection of the four fundamental material elements.

original: 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams ni mang po nyid yin la de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ltar gdon mi za bar phan tshun nges par lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams ni mang po nyid yin la de dag kyang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ltar gdon mi za bar phan tshun nges par lhan cig skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The substances of the elements are many, and they must arise simultaneously, since they are like derivative form, which is definitely simultaneous.

original: 'di ni rigs la rdzas su bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs la rdzas su bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rigs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis is a substance that is a type‚Äù means that earth, etc., are types.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu bshad pa 'byung ba bzhi tshan dag kyang sa la sogs pa'i rigs las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu bshad pa 'byung ba bzhi tshan dag kyang sa la sogs pa'i rigs las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the elements that are the cause of those are not beyond the type of earth and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa re re'i rten 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi rigs las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa re re'i rten 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi rigs las mi 'da' ste /
translated: The four elements that are the basis of each of the eyes and so on are not beyond the type of the four elements.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes 'byung ba'i bzhi tshan gcig nyid du bshad do //üîΩde ltar 'bad de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na rdzas yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi zhes 'byung ba'i bzhi tshan gcig nyid du bshad do // de ltar 'bad de zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na rdzas yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the four great elements are explained as a single set of four.üîΩThe Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThe four great elements are the basis of the others.‚ÄùüîΩHere, some are substantial entities alone,

original: cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas yin zhing /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas yin zhing /
translated: some are substantial entities of the sense bases,üîΩand some are substantial entities of types.

original: slar yang rigs kyi rdzas yin no zhes de ltar bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba 'di la don ci yod /
analyzed: slar yang rigs kyi rdzas yin no zhes de ltar bye brag tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba 'di la don ci yod /
translated: In order to teach this distinction, what is the meaning of the term element?

original: bdun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdun pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the seventh case is the meaning of the term element.

original: mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i rdzas su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i rdzas su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the substantial entity of the brief and extensive.

original: don la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci rdzas 'di dag nges par lhan cig skye ba yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: don la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci rdzas 'di dag nges par lhan cig skye ba yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: One should investigate the meaning of this passage.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: The master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: skye mched nges pa la yang 'byung ba'i rigs ni 'byung bar brjod la /
analyzed: skye mched nges pa la yang 'byung ba'i rigs ni 'byung bar brjod la /
translated: Even though the sense bases are definite, the type of element is called an element.

original: de yang dmigs kyis bsal ba du ma'i nges pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang dmigs kyis bsal ba du ma'i nges pa'i don to zhes zer ro //
translated: That is the definite meaning of many exceptions.

original: gang zhig 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gzhan ma yin pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gzhan ma yin pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ste /
translated: That which is not different from the elements and derivative form is an exception.

original: reg bya rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med pa dmigs kyis bsal ba 'dus pa thams cad la thams cad yod pa ma yin pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba dang grangs nges pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba so so skye bo'i rigs brjod pas ni sel ba yin no ras sto bha
analyzed: reg bya rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med pa dmigs kyis bsal ba 'dus pa thams cad la thams cad yod pa ma yin pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba dang grangs nges pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba so so skye bo'i rigs brjod pas ni sel ba yin no ras sto bha
translated: The exception of form not derived from the elements is that all collections do not have all. The exception of definite number is that the statement of the type of ordinary being is an exception.

original: ba ti / 'byung ba las gyur pa so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu nyid @180b yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i rdzas mang po nyid du thal ba yod pa ma yin te rigs nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba ti / 'byung ba las gyur pa so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu nyid @180b yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i rdzas mang po nyid du thal ba yod pa ma yin te rigs nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consequence that there would be many primary elements in a single derivative form does not apply, because the specific type of derivative form is determined by the specific primary elements that give rise to it.

original: gal te 'di thams cad 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten par 'gyur na cis gnod /
analyzed: gal te 'di thams cad 'byung ba bzhi tshan la brten par 'gyur na cis gnod /
translated: If all derivative forms are based on a collection of the four primary elements, what is the problem?

original: rigs tha dad pa dang 'gal ba'i 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhin zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o zhe na bden te /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa dang 'gal ba'i 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhin zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o zhe na bden te /
translated: The problem is that this contradicts the fact that the primary elements are of different types, just as the primary elements that act as the cause of derivative form are of different types.

original: rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par dang 'gal ba rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par dang 'gal ba rung ba ma yin te /
translated: This is a valid objection, but it is not contradictory for a specific result to arise from a specific cause.

original: gcig dang du ma'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi dbye ba bzhin no //üîΩde'i nye bar len pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba 'dir yang rigs la rjes su gzung zhes smos so //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi dbye ba bzhin no //üîΩde'i nye bar len pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba 'dir yang rigs la rjes su gzung zhes smos so //
translated: The primary elements do not have the capacity to produce a single or multiple result. Therefore, the primary elements are like the different types of derivative form.üîΩThe primary elements are of different types because they have different specific characteristics.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs phan tshun lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs phan tshun lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyu cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is form that is resistant and is a homogeneous cause?

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It is like form that accompanies the mind.

original: 'bras bu du ma rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ci zhig /
analyzed: 'bras bu du ma rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba ci zhig /
translated: What is form that is resistant and is a cause that is the equivalent and immediate antecedent?

original: ma nges par 'gyur ba ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ma nges par 'gyur ba ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is form that is resistant and is an indeterminate cause?

original: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par lhan cig skye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par lhan cig skye ba bshad zin to //
translated: The fixed rule for the simultaneous arising of form has been explained.

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: In the desire realm, the subtle atom has eight substances.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyis brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rest should be explained in the same way.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: This refers to the mind, mental factors, and the dissociated formative forces.

original: sems dang sems 'byung nges lhan cig //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang sems 'byung nges lhan cig // ces bya ba la /
translated: The mind and mental factors definitely arise simultaneously.

original: sems thams cad sems las byung ba thams cad dam /
analyzed: sems thams cad sems las byung ba thams cad dam /
translated: What is the mind that is a cause of all mental factors?

original: sems las byung ba thams cad sems thams cad dang nges par lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad sems thams cad dang nges par lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: All mental factors do not definitely arise simultaneously with all minds.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun bral ba skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams phan tshun bral ba skye ba ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be ascertained that minds and mental factors do not arise without mutual dependence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail:

original: phan tshun rag las te lus rnyed pa'i phyir phan tshun med na 'byung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phan tshun rag las te lus rnyed pa'i phyir phan tshun med na 'byung bar mi nus so //
translated: Because they are mutually dependent and acquire a body, they are unable to occur without mutual dependence.

original: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang ; / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: All are characterized by conditioned states.

original: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed dag yin gyi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin te skye ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed dag yin gyi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin te skye ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are conditioned states of form, mind, mental factors, and derivative form, not unconditioned states, because they are governed by arising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang cung zad skye ba zhes smos so //üîΩthob ba'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang cung zad skye ba zhes smos so // thob ba'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúWhatever arises. ‚Äù

original: thob pa ni rang gi @181a * //
analyzed: thob pa ni rang gi @181a * //
translated: Obtainment is obtained

original: rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Those that are included in the stream are obtained by sentient beings.

original: sems can du ston pa kho na thob pa dang lhan cig gdon mi za bar skye'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa kho na thob pa dang lhan cig gdon mi za bar skye'o //
translated: That is, they are definitely generated together with the obtainment of sentient beings.

original: sems can du mi ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can du mi ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not obtained by non-sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par brtag pa'i don du'am zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par brtag pa'i don du'am zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: For that very reason, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is stated in the verse.

original: cung zad cig ni thob pa dang lhan cig skye la /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni thob pa dang lhan cig skye la /
translated: Some are generated together with obtainment,üîΩand some are not generated.

original: cung zad cig me skye'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad cig me skye'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to demonstrate that.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus byas rnam pa bzhi las gzugs ni phung po bstan par rnam par phye zin to //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus byas rnam pa bzhi las gzugs ni phung po bstan par rnam par phye zin to //
translated: Among the four types of conditioned phenomena just explained, form has already been distinguished in the teaching on the aggregates.

original: sems ni khams bstan par ro //
analyzed: sems ni khams bstan par ro //
translated: Mind has already been distinguished in the teaching on the elements.

original: sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams rnam par dbye ba ma byas te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams rnam par dbye ba ma byas te /
translated: Mental factors and non-associated compositional factors have not yet been distinguished.

original: de'i phyir sems las byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems las byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the distinctions of mental factors,

original: sems byung rnam lnga ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems byung rnam lnga ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúMental factors are fivefold.‚Äù

original: sa zhes bya ba ni go skabs kyi yul te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgo skabs zhes bya ba ni go'am skye ba'o //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni go skabs kyi yul te zhes bya ba'o // go skabs zhes bya ba ni go'am skye ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Domain‚Äù means that which is generated.

original: gang zhig gang gi go skabs kyi yul yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi go skabs kyi yul yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äú That which is generated by what‚Äù means that which is generated by what.

original: gang du gang gi go mi 'jug pa de ni go skabs kyi yul te /
analyzed: gang du gang gi go mi 'jug pa de ni go skabs kyi yul te /
translated: That which is not generated in a certain place is the domain of that place.

original: de nyid la 'jig rten nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la 'jig rten nas zhes bya'o //
translated: That is what is meant by ‚Äúin the world.‚Äù

original: de la 'di dag la sa mang po yod pas na sa mang po pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'di dag la sa mang po yod pas na sa mang po pa rnams te /
translated: The term ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù means that which is found in many places.

original: gang dag rnam pa thams cad du sems thams cad dang lhan cig skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag rnam pa thams cad du sems thams cad dang lhan cig skye ba'o //
translated: They are found in all aspects and in all minds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems ni sa chen po pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems ni sa chen po pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not a universal mental factor,

original: sems gzhan dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur in conjunction with other minds.üîΩThe domain of the universal mental factors is the domain of the universal mental factors.

original: go skabs kyi yul ni go skabs kyi yul lo zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pas sems dang mngon par 'brel lo //
analyzed: go skabs kyi yul ni go skabs kyi yul lo zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pas sems dang mngon par 'brel lo //
translated: The object of the universal mental factors is the same as the object of the mind, because they are associated with the mind in terms of object and aspect.

original: rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa la sogs pa rnams la sdug bsngal 'brel lo zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pas 'dir dogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa la sogs pa rnams la sdug bsngal 'brel lo zhes pa'i tshig gis 'phangs pas 'dir dogs pa skye'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúconnected‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúconnected with suffering‚Äù is supplied in all cases, so this doubt arises here.

original: rten gyi yul nyid kyis 'chad par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir 'di las sa gang yin pa de dag de'i rten nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rten gyi yul nyid kyis 'chad par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir 'di las sa gang yin pa de dag de'i rten nyid du brjod do //
translated: Because it is explained by the object of the basis itself, it is said that whatever level is the basis of that.

original: sa chen po pa ni rten nyid du yongs su bcad pas yul chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa chen po pa ni rten nyid du yongs su bcad pas yul chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The great level is called ‚Äúgreat object‚Äù because it is determined as the basis.

original: sems thams cad la 'byung ba de'i phyir 'di legs par 'brel lo //
analyzed: sems thams cad la 'byung ba de'i phyir 'di legs par 'brel lo //
translated: Because it occurs in all minds, it is well connected.

original: chos bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba byas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba byas par 'byung ba la /
translated: These ten dharmas are said to be the great object.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid la byed pa dang btang snyoms mi rtsol ba gnyis sems gyi skad cig gcig la 'gal bas mi 'dod par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni yid la byed pa dang btang snyoms mi rtsol ba gnyis sems gyi skad cig gcig la 'gal bas mi 'dod par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúsaid‚Äù is used because it is taught that the two, attention and equanimity, are incompatible in a single moment of mind.

original: @181b tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @181b tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Feeling is experience.

original: sngar tshor ba'i rang gi ngo bo bshad nas da ni rab tu dbye ba tsam zhig ston pa ni myong ba rnams pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sngar tshor ba'i rang gi ngo bo bshad nas da ni rab tu dbye ba tsam zhig ston pa ni myong ba rnams pa gsum ste /
translated: Having previously explained the nature of feeling, now the mere classification of feeling is taught.

original: dbang po rnam par gzhag par lus kyi dang sems kyi dbye ba rnam par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni myong ba rnam pa gsum pa las mi 'da'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dbang po rnam par gzhag par lus kyi dang sems kyi dbye ba rnam par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni myong ba rnam pa gsum pa las mi 'da'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes bshad do //
translated: The three types of experience are explained in order to show that the classification of the body and mind in the presentation of the faculties does not go beyond the three types of experience.üîΩThe three types of experience are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.üîΩThe experience of pleasure is generated by contact that benefits the body, the experience of pain is generated by contact that harms the body, and the experience of neither pleasure nor pain is generated by contact that is neither beneficial nor harmful to the body.

original: de la bde pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i nyams su myong ba ni go rims bzhin du lus la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa dang snyoms par byed pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang gnyis
analyzed: de la bde pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i nyams su myong ba ni go rims bzhin du lus la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa dang snyoms par byed pa 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang gnyis
translated: The experience of pleasure is desired, the experience of pain is not desired, and the experience of neither pleasure nor pain is both desired and not desired.

original: ka las bzlog pa'i reg pas bskyed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ka las bzlog pa'i reg pas bskyed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three types of experience are generated by contact that is the opposite of both.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mental intention is the formation of the mind.

original: sems pa ni yid g-yo ba dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dman pa dang bar ma dang gya nom pa sems g-yo ba dang rab tu g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni yid g-yo ba dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dman pa dang bar ma dang gya nom pa sems g-yo ba dang rab tu g-yo ba ste /
translated: Mind is the movement of the mind, virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral, inferior, middling, and superior, the movement of the mind, the full movement of the mind.

original: gang zhig yod na khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba ltar sems dmigs pa la g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig yod na khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba ltar sems dmigs pa la g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When it exists, the mind moves to the focal object, like iron moving due to the power of a magnet.

original: skad cig gzhan du mi gnas shing //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan du mi gnas shing //
translated: It does not remain for a second moment.

original: byed med yid kyang gang gis na //
analyzed: byed med yid kyang gang gis na //
translated: What is the mind that is without action?

original: byed dang bcas par snang gyur pa //
analyzed: byed dang bcas par snang gyur pa //

analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rigs tha dad pa rnams la rkyen no zhes rkyen du gyur pa bstan pas mthong ba'i phyir 'di las kyang 'dus pa ma yin na der reg pa sems las byung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir tshor ba la

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la lus kyi zhes bshad pa de bzhin du lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang rig par bya ste /
translated: Just as pliancy is called bodily because it is associated with the five consciousnesses of the body, so too should physical pliancy be understood.

original: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa la lus kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa la lus kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though it is mental, it is called bodily because it is based on the physical sense faculties.

original: de yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba rnams su rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba rnams su rung ba nyid de /
translated: It is also associated with virtuous eye consciousness, etc.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni dge ba'i sa mang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni dge ba'i sa mang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pliancy is a universal of the virtuous mental factors.

original: des na lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis la ngo bo khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid khyab pa yin gyi ma khyab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis la ngo bo khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid khyab pa yin gyi ma khyab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference in the nature of physical and mental pliancy, it is a characteristic that pervades both, it is not a characteristic that does not pervade both.

original: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it a branch of enlightenment?

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag tu rung ba ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag tu rung ba ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: because eye consciousness and so on are on the level of nonequipoise and the factors conducive to enlightenment are uncontaminated, pliancy concomitant with eye consciousness and so on is not suitable to be a factor conducive to enlightenment.

original: 'o na mdo der ni lus las su rung ba 'byung ba'i khyad par dga' bas drangs pa kho na lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na mdo der ni lus las su rung ba 'byung ba'i khyad par dga' bas drangs pa kho na lus shin tu sbyangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: But in that sutra, physical pliancy is recognized to be the special arising of physical flexibility induced by joy.üîΩFor a sutra states:

original: mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa'i yid dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa'i yid dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is delighted by physical pliancy.

original: kha cig na re lus mnyen pa nyid du zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re lus mnyen pa nyid du zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is physical suppleness.

original: @185b de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @185b de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can it be called a factor conducive to enlightenment?

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni yid kyi sa pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams ni yid kyi sa pa dang zag pa med pa dag yin la /
translated: The factors conducive to enlightenment are on the mental level and uncontaminated.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: Physical pliancy is not by nature a mental factor.

original: de byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: It is not suitable as a branch of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang mthun pa'i phyir te zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is compatible with the branch of enlightenment.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa de ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid can dang rjes su mthun pas de la yang byang chub kyi yan lag ces brjod do //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa de ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi bdag nyid can dang rjes su mthun pas de la yang byang chub kyi yan lag ces brjod do //
translated: Physical pliancy is compatible with mental pliancy, which is the nature of the branch of enlightenment. Therefore it is also called a branch of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar mthun zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthun zhe na /
translated: How is it compatible?

original: lus las su rung ba de ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus las su rung ba de ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Physical pliancy is compatible with mental pliancy.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang mthun pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang mthun pa'i phyir de dang 'dra bar nye bar 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Although it is not by nature that, it is similar to it and is designated as such because it is compatible with it.

original: dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang rjes su mthun pas dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs shing /
analyzed: dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang rjes su mthun pas dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs shing /
translated: Though phenomena that are the basis of joy are not the nature of joy, they are said to be the correct branch of awakening of joy because they are compatible with the correct branch of awakening of joy.

original: khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu gnod sems dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir gnod sems kyi sgrib par gsungs la /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu gnod sems dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir gnod sems kyi sgrib par gsungs la /
translated: And though the nine bases of complete disparaging, which are the reasons for anger, are not the nature of malice, they are said to be obscurations to malice because they are compatible with malice.

original: gang gi tshe lam phung po gsum par mdzad pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi phung por gsungs na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam phung po gsum par mdzad pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi phung por gsungs na /
translated: When the path is divided into three aggregates, correct thought and correct effort are said to be the aggregate of wisdom.

original: rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: But thought and effort are not by nature wisdom.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rtog pa ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: rtog pa ni brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Thought is by nature effort.

original: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba bying ba dang rgod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te sems tshul bzhin du rgyu ba las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba bying ba dang rgod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te sems tshul bzhin du rgyu ba las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Equanimity is the mental factor of equanimity, the antidote to the mental dissatisfaction of depression and excitement.

original: sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be the proper engagement of the mind.

original: gzhan dag na re yid la bya ba'i gegs yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re yid la bya ba'i gegs yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the obstruction to attention.

original: 'di ni 'du byed btang snyoms par reg bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed btang snyoms par reg bya'o //
translated: This is the equanimity of formation.

original: tshor ba ni myong ba rnam gsum mo zhes bya ba de nyid las de smos pa'i phyir tshor ba btang snyoms ma yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba ni myong ba rnam gsum mo zhes bya ba de nyid las de smos pa'i phyir tshor ba btang snyoms ma yin la /
translated: Since it is said in the Abhidharma that feeling is the three types of experience, equanimity is not feeling.

original: dge ba'i sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir tshad med pa btang snyoms kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir tshad med pa btang snyoms kyang ma yin no //
translated: And since it occurs in all virtuous minds, equanimity is not an immeasurables.

original: da ni ji ltar na zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Now, how is it that equanimity is not feeling?

original: sa mang po ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dang btang @186a * //
analyzed: sa mang po ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dang btang @186a * //
translated: It is said that equanimity is not feeling because it is a universal mental state and because it is a virtuous mental state.

original: snyoms dag sems gcig la 'byung ba de ni 'thad pa yang ma yin te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms dag sems gcig la 'byung ba de ni 'thad pa yang ma yin te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also untenable that they occur in a single moment of mind, because they are mutually contradictory.

original: shes par dka' ba yang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes par dka' ba yang zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: It is difficult to understand how they are not contradictory.

original: gang zhig reg pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sems kyi skad cig gcig la sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dang mi 'gal ba de ni shes par dka' yang shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig reg pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sems kyi skad cig gcig la sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan dang mi 'gal ba de ni shes par dka' yang shes pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is difficult to understand how contact is not contradictory with a single moment of mind, then it is difficult to understand how other mental factors are not contradictory with a single moment of mind.

original: gang zhig rtsol ba dang rtsol ba med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig la 'byung ba mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu shes par dka' ste /
analyzed: gang zhig rtsol ba dang rtsol ba med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig la 'byung ba mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu shes par dka' ste /
translated: But it is extremely difficult to understand how effort and non-effort, which are mutually contradictory, are not contradictory in a single mind.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gal ba dag ni sems gcig la 'byung bar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gal ba dag ni sems gcig la 'byung bar ma mthong ngo //
translated: We have never seen pleasure and pain, which are contradictory, arise in a single mind.

original: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Effort arises in one way and non-effort arises in another way.

original: chos gzhan nyid du yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba nyid rtsol ba med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chos gzhan nyid du yin pa'i phyir rtsol ba nyid rtsol ba med pa ma yin la /
translated: Effort is not non-effort because they are different phenomena.

original: de gnyis dngos po gcig la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis dngos po gcig la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, those two are not engaged in one thing,üîΩbecause when one exerts oneself with respect to form, at that time one does not exert oneself with respect to sound and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la rtsol ba de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa dag la rtsol ba med pa yin pas 'di la 'gal ba zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la rtsol ba de'i tshe sgra la sogs pa dag la rtsol ba med pa yin pas 'di la 'gal ba zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you say that there is no contradiction here,

original: 'o na ni da zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni da zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: then in the phrase ‚Äúnow, etc.,‚Äù

original: rtsol ba dang rtsol ba med pa gnyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtsol ba dang rtsol ba med pa gnyis yul tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig par mi 'gyur na /
translated: since exertion and nonexertion are different objects, all concomitant states would not have the same focal object.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dmigs pa tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dmigs pa tha dad pa nyid du 'dod pa yang yin te /
translated: But it is asserted that concomitant states have different focal objects,

original: dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis mtshungs par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis mtshungs par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are accepted as concomitant due to having the same focal object.

original: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs zhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis bzhin du 'gal yang mi 'gal ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs zhes bya ba la / dper na rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis bzhin du 'gal yang mi 'gal ba'i rigs te /
translated: In this case, it is like the phrase ‚Äúthis type of thing,‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is a type of thing that is not contradictory, even though it is contradictory,

original: rtsing pa dang zhib pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsing pa dang zhib pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like both investigation and analysis, because coarseness and subtlety are mutually contradictory.

original: mi 'gal ba ni sems gcig la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba ni sems gcig la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction, because they occur in the same mind.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dag ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dag ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Shame and embarrassment will be explained later.

original: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of embarrassment are disrespect.

original: ces bya ba der te /
analyzed: ces bya ba der te /
translated: This will be explained in the chapter on the mental factors.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa las bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khral yod par rig par bya'o //üîΩgzhan dag na re rigs shing tshad mar gyur pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas nas skyes pa sred pa med pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang 'gal ba'i sems kyi dbang du gyur pa ni ngo tsha med pa yin la /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa las bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khral yod par rig par bya'o // gzhan dag na re rigs shing tshad mar gyur pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas nas skyes pa sred pa med pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang 'gal ba'i sems kyi dbang du gyur pa ni ngo tsha med pa yin la /
translated: Shamelessness and lack of embarrassment should be understood as the opposites of shame and embarrassment.üîΩOthers say: Shamelessness is the cause and outcome of craving that is not in accord with the Dharma of the wise and holy, and it is a mental factor that is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: yon tan la ma goms sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gti @186b mug med pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / 'gal ba dman zhing smad pa'i chos ni khrel med pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yon tan la ma goms sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gti @186b mug med pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / 'gal ba dman zhing smad pa'i chos ni khrel med pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Lack of embarrassment is the cause and outcome of delusion that is not in accord with the Dharma of the wise and holy, and it is a mental factor that is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag na re ngan 'gro dang gzhan gyis smod pa'i 'jigs pa rgyu mtshan du mi byed pa ni ngo tsha med pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ngan 'gro dang gzhan gyis smod pa'i 'jigs pa rgyu mtshan du mi byed pa ni ngo tsha med pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Shamelessness is not making the fear of miserable realms and the criticism of others a reason.

original: rtsa ba gnyis ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The two roots are...

original: de la ma chags pa ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'i yul la lhag par zhen pa dang don du gnyer ba dang 'gal zhing mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa'i yul la lhag par zhen pa dang don du gnyer ba dang 'gal zhing mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment is the opposite of attachment to objects such as gain and honor and the pursuit of their purpose. It is nonattachment.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni sems can rnams la gnod sems med cing rjes su brtse ba'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni sems can rnams la gnod sems med cing rjes su brtse ba'i sa bon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Nonhatred is the seed of compassion, which is the absence of malice toward sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dge ba'i sems thams cad la mtshungs par 'byung yang gti mug med pa ma bstan pas dge ba'i sa mang po ba'i bshad pa ma tshang ba yin no snyam du dogs pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams phan tshun med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dge ba'i sems thams cad la mtshungs par 'byung yang gti mug med pa ma bstan pas dge ba'i sa mang po ba'i bshad pa ma tshang ba yin no snyam du dogs pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Since roots of virtue are mutually nondeprived, they occur equally in all virtuous minds. However, since nondelusion is not mentioned, it is suspected that the explanation of the great ground of virtue is incomplete.

original: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: To eliminate that doubt, the root text says, ‚ÄúNondelusion also exists,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is how it should be explained.

original: gang dag dge ba'i sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin te /
translated: Since it occurs in other virtuous minds as well, it is a universal of the virtuous.

original: gti mug med pa ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sa mang po pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sa mang po pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-delusion is called a universal because it is the nature of wisdom.

original: de nas sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas sems gzhan la yang 'byung bas dge ba'i sa mang po pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it does not occur in other minds, it is not a universal of the virtuous,

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like aspiration and so on.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i bshad pa la ma tshang ba nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po pa'i bshad pa la ma tshang ba nyid med do //
translated: Therefore there is no incompleteness in the explanation of the universal of the virtuous.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par mtho mi 'tsham pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par mtho mi 'tsham pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Non-violence is the opposite of violence.

original: sems can gzhan la gnod par dga' ba dang dga' ba sems bzang po nyid ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la gnod par dga' ba dang dga' ba sems bzang po nyid ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: The opposite of delighting in and delighting others in harm is a good mind, which is non-violence.

original: brtson 'grus ni sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Effort is the mental factor that is the complete exertion of the mind.

original: yon tan dang skyon skyes zin pa kun tu bsrung ba dang spang ba dang ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sems la le lo med pa ni mngon par spro ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon skyes zin pa kun tu bsrung ba dang spang ba dang ma skyes pa bskyed pa dang mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir sems la le lo med pa ni mngon par spro ba ste /
translated: Lack of laziness of mind in order to protect all virtues and faults that have arisen, to abandon them, to generate those that have not arisen, and to not generate those that have not arisen is enthusiasm.

original: gang yod na sems rigs par rtsom pa dang mchog tu 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gang yod na sems rigs par rtsom pa dang mchog tu 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: That by which the mind is properly engaged and becomes supreme is effort.

original: 'dir dang gi sgra ni skyob dang rab tu dga' ba bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir dang gi sgra ni skyob dang rab tu dga' ba bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: Here the word ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of collecting protection and delight.

original: de la skyo ba ni dge ba'i sems nye bar 'tshe ba du mas nye bar gtses pa'i chos de nyid nye bar mtshon pa chags bral dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la skyo ba ni dge ba'i sems nye bar 'tshe ba du mas nye bar gtses pa'i chos de nyid nye bar mtshon pa chags bral dang rjes su mthun pa'i yid 'byung ba ste /
translated: Among them, protection is the mind that is afflicted by many afflictions of virtue, and is the indication of that dharma, which is the renunciation that is in accord with detachment.

original: gang dang mtshungs par ldan na nges par 'byung ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dang mtshungs par ldan na nges par 'byung ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is associated with that, it is called the mental attention of renunciation.

original: @187a * // rab tu dga' ba ni dge ba'i sems nye bar 'tshe ba las nges par 'byin pa'i gnyen po 'tshol ba de rtogs pas yid yongs su tshim pa ste /
analyzed: @187a * // rab tu dga' ba ni dge ba'i sems nye bar 'tshe ba las nges par 'byin pa'i gnyen po 'tshol ba de rtogs pas yid yongs su tshim pa ste /
translated: Extreme joy is the mental attention called extreme joy, which is the complete satisfaction of the mind through the realization of the remedy that definitely removes the harm to the virtuous mind.

original: dga' ba dang ma bral ba rnams la yang mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams la gang dang mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang ma bral ba rnams la yang mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams la gang dang mtshungs par ldan pas rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is associated with the mental attention of extreme joy in the stages of unrestricted access concentration and so on, which are not divorced from joy.

original: de gnyis ni rnam pa 'gal ba'i phyir sems gcig la srid pa ma yin pas dge ba'i sa mang po ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byed pa dag las ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni rnam pa 'gal ba'i phyir sems gcig la srid pa ma yin pas dge ba'i sa mang po ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byed pa dag las ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since these two are incompatible in aspect, they cannot exist in a single mind, and it is untenable that they are universal mental states because they are not mentioned in the treatise.

original: gang gi phyir yid bde ba ni skyo ba'i rnam pas kyang 'jug pa yod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid bde ba ni skyo ba'i rnam pas kyang 'jug pa yod la /
translated: Because mental satisfaction also engages with the aspect of renunciation.

original: rab tu dga' ba la ni skyo ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir dang gi sgra gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la ni skyo ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir dang gi sgra gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: Extreme joy does not have the aspect of renunciation.

original: tshogs pa gnyis la de dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gnyis la de dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that reason, the two terms are stated because they are observed in two collections.

original: 'di dag la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po yod pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kho na ston to //
analyzed: 'di dag la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po yod pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kho na ston to //
translated: The term ‚Äúwith the many grounds of affliction‚Äù indicates that these are only associated with the mind through the ground of affliction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la rtag tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: That is why it says, ‚ÄúThey always occur in an afflicted mind.‚Äù

original: de la rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //üîΩma rig pa 'di gang zhig ce na mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o // ma rig pa 'di gang zhig ce na mi shes pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù is ignorance.üîΩWhat is this ignorance? It is non-knowledge.

original: mi shes pa 'di gang zhe na mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa 'di gang zhe na mi gsal ba'o //
translated: What is this non-knowledge? It is non-clarity.

original: mi gsal ba 'di yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: mi gsal ba 'di yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this non-clarity?

original: gsal ba ni shes rab yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba ni shes rab yin te /
translated: Clarity is wisdom.

original: de'i phyir shes bya dag la ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can chos ni rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya dag la ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa'i gegs su gyur pa'i mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can chos ni rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the dharma that has the characteristic of non-clarity, which is an obstruction to the proper understanding of knowable objects, is called ‚Äúdelusion.‚Äù

original: bag med pa ni dge ba'i ches rnams mi bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba'i ches rnams mi bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúNegligence‚Äù is not cultivating the roots of virtue.

original: gang zhig yod na zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúwhen it exists‚Äù should be supplied.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ni ma rnyed pa rnams mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ni ma rnyed pa rnams mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not cultivating virtuous dharmas is not actualizing those not yet obtained.

original: bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan pa gces su 'dzin pa yal bar 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan pa gces su 'dzin pa yal bar 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The counteragent to cultivation is the cherishing of one's own benefit, which is the opposite of cherishing others.üîΩLaziness is the non-exaltation of the mind.

original: le lo ni sems mngon par mi spro pa ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la ste do nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: le lo ni sems mngon par mi spro pa ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la ste do nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it is the opposite of effort, it is called the counteragent to effort.

original: de ltar byas pa na mi dge ba'i las la sems mngon par spro ba de ni brtson 'grus ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa na mi dge ba'i las la sems mngon par spro ba de ni brtson 'grus ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the exaltation of the mind towards non-virtuous actions is not effort.

original: de ni rigs pa'i @187b rgyu mthun pa'i le lo ste /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa'i @187b rgyu mthun pa'i le lo ste /
translated: That is laziness which is the natural outflow of reasoning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus dman pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brtson 'grus dman pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is called the inferiority of effort.

original: dman par zhugs pas na le lo ste /
analyzed: dman par zhugs pas na le lo ste /
translated: Because it engages in inferiority, it is laziness.

original: de'i ngo bo ni le lo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni le lo nyid do //
translated: Its nature is laziness itself.

original: ma dad pa ni sems ma dad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni sems ma dad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Lack of faith is the lack of faith in the mind.

original: log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: It is the natural outflow of wrong view.

original: bden pa dang dkon mchog dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la brnyes pas nye bar gnas pa sbyin pa la sogs pa dang de'i 'bras bu la ni yid mi ches shing dad pa mngon par mi skyed pa ste ma dad pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang dkon mchog dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la brnyes pas nye bar gnas pa sbyin pa la sogs pa dang de'i 'bras bu la ni yid mi ches shing dad pa mngon par mi skyed pa ste ma dad pa'o //
translated: It is lack of faith in generosity, etc., and their results, and lack of faith in the truths, gems, and meditative concentrations.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa'i mi mthun phyogs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dad pa'i mi mthun phyogs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the opposite of faith.

original: rmugs pa gang zhen zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /üîΩtshig snga ma snga ma gnyis rnam par bshad pa yin par bsams te /
analyzed: rmugs pa gang zhen zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la / tshig snga ma snga ma gnyis rnam par bshad pa yin par bsams te /
translated: What is lethargy?üîΩThe two latter terms are stated in order to explain the two former terms.

original: tshig phyi ma gnyis mngon par brjod do //üîΩ'gal ba dang mi dga' bas bskyed pa'i sems lci ba ni rmugs pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma gnyis mngon par brjod do // 'gal ba dang mi dga' bas bskyed pa'i sems lci ba ni rmugs pa nyid de /
translated: The two former terms are stated in order to explain the two latter terms.üîΩLethargy is a heaviness of mind that is produced by discouragement and lack of delight.üîΩIt is a heaviness of mind that is produced by discouragement and lack of delight.

original: gang gis bzung na blun pa nyid kyi tshul gyis sems las su mi rung ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis bzung na blun pa nyid kyi tshul gyis sems las su mi rung ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is a heaviness of mind that is produced by discouragement and lack of delight.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the opposite of tranquility.

original: lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same is true of bodily feeling.üîΩJust as feeling is called bodily because it is based on a material faculty,

original: dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skye ba'i phyir sems kyi yin bzhin du lus kyi zhes bya ba brjod pa de bzhin du /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rmugs pa sems kyi kho na yin bzhin du /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten nas skye ba'i phyir sems kyi yin bzhin du lus kyi zhes bya ba brjod pa de bzhin du / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rmugs pa sems kyi kho na yin bzhin du /
translated: so torpor is called bodily because it is based on a material faculty, even though it is really mental.

original: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes brjod do //
translated: The five collections of consciousness are mental torpor, but they are called bodily because they are based on material faculties.

original: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba chen po skyed par byed pa'i phyir sems kyi sngon du 'gro bas lus lci ba nyid kyang rmugs pa'i sgras brjod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'byung ba chen po skyed par byed pa'i phyir sems kyi sngon du 'gro bas lus lci ba nyid kyang rmugs pa'i sgras brjod kyi /
translated: Others say that bodily heaviness is called torpor because it precedes the heaviness of the mind, since it produces the great elements.

original: rmugs pa de lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa de lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: But torpor is not the object of the body consciousness.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag gi tha dad du byed pa ni /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag gi tha dad du byed pa ni /
translated: The difference between torpor and sleep is as follows:

original: sems las su mi rung bas rmugs pa dang / sems mngon par sdud pas gnyid do //
analyzed: sems las su mi rung bas rmugs pa dang / sems mngon par sdud pas gnyid do //
translated: Torpor is unfitness of the mind, and sleep is the contraction of the mind.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Excitement is an unfitness of the mind.

original: 'dod pas bskyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa las skyes pa sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pas bskyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa las skyes pa sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
translated: It is a disturbed mind that arises from thoughts that are moved by desire.

original: gang dang ldan na lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur ba de ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan na lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur ba de ni rgod pa'o //
translated: It is agitation that causes one to enter a wrong path.

original: chos mngon ba las zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /üîΩbrjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin @188a * //
analyzed: chos mngon ba las zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la / brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshul bzhin @188a * //
translated: The Abhidharma states that there are ten entanglements.

original: ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / ma bstan pa'i rmugs pa nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po ba'i nang du brjod pa'i phyir /üîΩchos mngon pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /üîΩ'gyur ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung tshad mar byas te bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba shes kyi /
analyzed: ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par mos pa nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / ma bstan pa'i rmugs pa nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po ba'i nang du brjod pa'i phyir / chos mngon pa dang 'gal lo zhe na / 'gyur ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzhung tshad mar byas te bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba shes kyi /
translated: It is contradictory to state that forgetfulness, distraction, nonintrospection, incorrect mental application, and false resolve are entanglements that are only found among the secondary afflictions, and that lethargy is not taught as a secondary affliction.üîΩThe statement that there are ten entanglements is based on the Abhidharma.

original: slob dpon gyi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi 'dod pa ste /
translated: The master Vasubandhu asserts that there are ten entanglements.

original: slob dpon gyi bzhed pa ni shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi bzhed pa ni shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The master does not assert that there are ten entanglements.

original: brjed ngas pa la sogs pa de dag ni sa mang po ba yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yod kyang 'dir de dag gi nang du mi rigs te /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa la sogs pa de dag ni sa mang po ba yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yod kyang 'dir de dag gi nang du mi rigs te /
translated: Since forgetfulness, etc., are universal mental factors, they exist as universal contaminants. But they are not included here,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams kho na 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams kho na 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the intention to explain only the universal contaminants.

original: yang ci ltar de dag sa mang po ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar de dag sa mang po ba yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how are they universal contaminants?

original: de'i phyir dran pa nyon mongs pa can kho na zhes rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa nyon mongs pa can kho na zhes rgya cher smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúonly afflicted mindfulness, etc.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho nas shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can kho na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho nas shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can kho na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to only afflicted wisdom, not to vigilance, and only afflicted attention, not to improper attention.

original: mos pa nyon mongs pa can kho na log par mos pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pa nyon mongs pa can kho na log par mos pa yin no //
translated: Only afflicted resolve is wrong resolve.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dran pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can dag kho na brjed ngas pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dran pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can dag kho na brjed ngas pa la sogs pa dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because only afflicted mindfulness, etc., are forgetfulness, etc.

original: de ltar na mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are four possibilities.

original: dran pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mindfulness, etc., are of the nature of both the great ground and the great afflictive ground.

original: mu dang po ni sa mang po pa kho na ste tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so //üîΩgnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mu dang po ni sa mang po pa kho na ste tshor ba la sogs pa rnams so // gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa kho na ste /
translated: The first possibility is the great ground alone, such as feeling, etc.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The second is the great afflictive ground alone, such as faithlessness, etc.

original: gsum pa ni sa mang po pa dag kyang yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sa mang po pa dag kyang yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag kyang yin te /
translated: The third is those that are both the great ground and the great afflictive ground,

original: dran pa la sogs pa lnga'o //üîΩbzhi pa ni sa mang po pa dag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa lnga'o // bzhi pa ni sa mang po pa dag kyang ma yin la /
translated: such as the five such as mindfulness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po ba dag kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po ba dag kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The fourth is those that are neither the great ground nor the great afflictive ground.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams dang / gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams dang / gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those not included in those types are the great virtuous ground, the small afflictive ground, and others such as the nonassociated formative forces.

original: de dag gi mu bzhi ba ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi mu bzhi ba ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four possibilities for those are not like that.

original: ji ltar de ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not so?

original: sngar ne le lo la sogs pa chos lnga mu gnyis pa yin par @188b bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ne le lo la sogs pa chos lnga mu gnyis pa yin par @188b bshad la /
translated: Previously, the five dharmas such as laziness were explained as two alternatives.

original: da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba lhag par bsnan te drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba lhag par bsnan te drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, distraction is added to make six.

original: sngar ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang bcas pa lnga mu gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang bcas pa lnga mu gsum pa yin la /
translated: Previously, the five with distraction were three alternatives.

original: da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba bor ba bzhi yin no //
analyzed: da lta ni rnam par g-yeng ba bor ba bzhi yin no //
translated: Now, the four without distraction are four alternatives.

original: sngar ni tshor ba la sogs pa chos bzhi mu dang po yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni tshor ba la sogs pa chos bzhi mu dang po yin la /
translated: Previously, the four dharmas such as feeling were the first alternative.

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin /
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin /
translated: Now, concentration

original: lhag par bstan te lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag par bstan te lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: is taught as the fifth.

original: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba gang smras pa de'i lan ni /üîΩrmugs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba gang smras pa de'i lan ni / rmugs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúDrowsiness does not occur there,‚Äù the answer is:üîΩDrowsiness is not a root affliction because it is not mentioned as a root affliction in the Abhidharma.

original: rmongs pa la sogs pa ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rmongs pa la sogs pa ltar nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po bar 'dod pas /
translated: It is asserted to be a great ground affliction because it is concomitant with all afflictions, like delusion and so on.

original: de ltar de nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan yang nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa su zhig gis nyes /
analyzed: de ltar de nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan yang nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa su zhig gis nyes /
translated: Thus, though it is characterized as a great ground of affliction, who is to blame for not including it among the great grounds of affliction?

original: ci ngas nyes sam /
analyzed: ci ngas nyes sam /
translated: Is it my fault?

original: 'on te chos mngon pa gang dag mi 'don pas nyes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te chos mngon pa gang dag mi 'don pas nyes zer na /
translated: Or is it the fault of those who do not recite the Abhidharma?

original: gdon par bya ba ni yin mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba ni yin mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It should be recited, but it is not.

original: ci'i phyir ma bton zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma bton zhe na /
translated: Why is it not recited?

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ma bton no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i phyir ma bton no //
translated: It is not recited because it is compatible with concentration.

original: ji ltar na de dang mthun pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dang mthun pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it compatible?

original: rmugs pa spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu myur du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin shin tu myur du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: One who engages in lethargy quickly generates concentration, and so on.

original: rmugs pa ni rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Lethargy does not cause distraction.

original: de spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin myur du skye bar byed kyi /
analyzed: de spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin myur du skye bar byed kyi /
translated: One who engages in it quickly generates concentration.

original: rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One who engages in agitation does not.

original: rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes distraction.

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi srid pa'o //
