original: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtson 'grus dang btang snyoms dag cig car mi srid de /
analyzed: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // brtson 'grus dang btang snyoms dag cig car mi srid de /
translated: In some it is increased by regret.

original: 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir te 'gro ba dang sdod bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'gal ba'i phyir te 'gro ba dang sdod bzhin no //
translated: It is impossible for both effort and equanimity to occur simultaneously because they are contradictory, like going and sitting.

original: rtsol ba dang btang snyoms dag cig car ma yin te mdo las kyang 'di dag cig car 'byung ba bkag go //
analyzed: rtsol ba dang btang snyoms dag cig car ma yin te mdo las kyang 'di dag cig car 'byung ba bkag go //
translated: Exertion and equanimity do not occur simultaneously. The sutras also prohibit their simultaneous occurrence.

original: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
analyzed: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
translated: In some places, regret is added.

original: ma nges pa'i sa mang po pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i sa mang po pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two indeterminate factors in the great ground:

original: 'gyod pa dang gnyid do //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang gnyid do //
translated: regret and sleep.

original: gang gi phyir 'di gnyis ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di gnyis ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa ma yin la /
translated: Because these two are not in the sixth consciousness,

original: khams gsum pa yang ma yin zhing gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: khams gsum pa yang ma yin zhing gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la /
translated: are not in the three realms, and are not solely unwholesome,

original: de'i phyir de dag dge ba'i sems gang la 'gyod pa'i go skabs yod pa der de bsnan pas nyi shu rtsa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dge ba'i sems gang la 'gyod pa'i go skabs yod pa der de bsnan pas nyi shu rtsa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: regret is added to any wholesome mind where there is an opportunity for regret, making twenty-three.

original: ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo ni 'gyod @190b pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo ni 'gyod @190b pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regret is the nature of remorse.

original: byas pa nyid dang ni don 'brel gyi sems kyi chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang ni don 'brel gyi sems kyi chos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a mental factor that is related to the meaning of action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: For that very reason, it is said here:

original: ci 'gyod pa'i dmigs pa thams cad nyid 'gyod pa yin nam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'gyod pa'i dmigs pa thams cad nyid 'gyod pa yin nam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is regret the object of all remorse or is remorse not the object of regret?

original: yid la gcags pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa'o zhes so //
translated: It is mental pain.

original: ji ltar na 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ste de ni ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ste de ni ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhe na /
translated: How can remorse that has regret as its object be called regret? It is not the nature of something done wrongly.

original: dmigs par byed pa la dmigs pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa la dmigs pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of the mind is designated as the object of regret.

original: dper na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: For example, it is said that the object of emptiness is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni 'du byed rnams nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'du byed rnams nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba yin la /
translated: Emptiness is the absence of a creator, an inner being, in the aggregates.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Concentration that has that as its object is called the emptiness door of liberation.

original: mi sdug pa ni rnam par ba mas pa dang rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i dngos pos bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni rnam par ba mas pa dang rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i dngos pos bsdus pa yin la /
translated: The repulsive is the state of being included in the category of a bloated corpse, a livid corpse, and so on.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ma chags pa la mi sdug pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ma chags pa la mi sdug pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Nonattachment that has that as its object is called the repulsive.

original: yang na gnas pa'i gnas kyis btags pas ngan par byas pa la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa'i gnas kyis btags pas ngan par byas pa la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags pa la 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, regret is called remorse that focuses on a misdeed and is designated by the location of its abode.

original: gnas pa la gnas kyis btags pa gar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa la gnas kyis btags pa gar mthong zhe na /
translated: What is the location of the abode of remorse?

original: 'jig rten na yang zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIn the world, they say, ‚ÄòI regret it.‚Äô‚Äù

original: bstan bcos las yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos las yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is not only in treatises.

original: 'gyod pa yang yid la gcags pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin te de la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang yid la gcags pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin te de la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Regret is also the abode of remorse because it arises in dependence on that.

original: de'i phyir 'gyod pa zhes bya ba 'gyod pa gnas kyis gnas pa yid la gcags pa phyis gdung ba'i mtshan nyid can rton par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gyod pa zhes bya ba 'gyod pa gnas kyis gnas pa yid la gcags pa phyis gdung ba'i mtshan nyid can rton par byed do //
translated: Therefore, regret is the abode of remorse, which is designated by the abode of regret and is characterized by subsequent distress.

original: yang na 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alternatively, this is a case of the result being figuratively designated by the name of the cause.

original: rgyu ni 'gyod pa dang 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'gyod pa dang 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa'o //
translated: The cause is regret and the result is remorse.

original: rgyu la nye bar btags pa las 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la nye bar btags pa las 'gyod pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Regret is not figuratively designated by the name of the cause.

original: de nyid la dpe ni dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The example is, for example, ‚Äúthese six bases of contact‚Äù and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa rig pa'i skye mched rnams ni sngon gyi las ma yin te 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rig pa'i skye mched rnams ni sngon gyi las ma yin te 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The bases of cognition such as the eye are not prior karma. What then?

original: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi las yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi las yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: They are called prior karma because they are the result of prior karma.

original: kho na gang ma byas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la ma byas pa'i @191a * //
analyzed: kho na gang ma byas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la ma byas pa'i @191a * //
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚Äúthat which has the nature of non-performance is regret.‚Äù

original: ngo bo ni 'gyod pa yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo ni 'gyod pa yin na /
translated: If the nature of non-performance is regret,

original: ma byas pa ni ngan par byas pa ma yin pas de'i ngo bo 'gyod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa ni ngan par byas pa ma yin pas de'i ngo bo 'gyod par mi rung ste /
translated: non-performance is not bad performance, so it is not suitable to have the nature of regret.

original: de la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags mi dgos pa'i gnas kyi rgyu la nye bar btags pa las 'gyod par bstan pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags mi dgos pa'i gnas kyi rgyu la nye bar btags pa las 'gyod par bstan pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable to teach regret as a designation for the basis of the necessity of mental anguish that focuses on that. This is the intention of the questioner.

original: ma byas pa la yang byas pa zhes bya ba yod de zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa la yang byas pa zhes bya ba yod de zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: There is also the expression ‚Äúdone‚Äù for what is not done.üîΩThis is the extensive explanation.

original: de yang gang dge ba ma byas pa dang mi dge ba byas pa la yang brjod de /
analyzed: de yang gang dge ba ma byas pa dang mi dge ba byas pa la yang brjod de /
translated: Moreover, it is said that one does not do what is virtuous and one does what is not virtuous.

original: de la yang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod byar dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod byar dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, because the term ‚Äúdone‚Äù is the referent of the verbal expression,

original: ngan pa byas par brjod do //
analyzed: ngan pa byas par brjod do //
translated: it is said that one does what is evil.

original: 'gyod pa dge ba ni ngan par byas pa la dmigs pa ngan par byas pa la 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dge ba ni ngan par byas pa la dmigs pa ngan par byas pa la 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret that is virtuous is regret about what is evil that has been done.

original: bzlog pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Regret that is not virtuous is the opposite of that.

original: gang zhig mi dge ba ma byas pa dang dge ba byas pa de la'o /
analyzed: gang zhig mi dge ba ma byas pa dang dge ba byas pa de la'o /
translated: It is said that one does not do what is not virtuous and one does what is virtuous.

original: de gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Both of these are the basis for regret, that is, both what is virtuous and what is not virtuous.

original: 'gyod pa'o // gnyi ga la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul du dge ba dang mi dge ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa'o // gnyi ga la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul du dge ba dang mi dge ba la brten pa'o //
translated: Regret is in relation to both, that is, in relation to what is virtuous and what is not virtuous in the manner that has been explained.

original: lta dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lta dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: In relation to one who possesses view,

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: the term ‚Äúand‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: lta dang ldan pa nyi shu nyid 'gyod pa ma 'dres pa la yang go skabs yod do zhes mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lta dang ldan pa nyi shu nyid 'gyod pa ma 'dres pa la yang go skabs yod do zhes mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: The twenty views are also an opportunity for remorse that is not mixed with other defilements.

original: 'gyod pa dge ba nyid la ni phra rgyas gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dge ba nyid la ni phra rgyas gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: But remorse that is wholesome is not unaccompanied by other proclivities.

original: 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dag ni dga' ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa dag go zhes bya ba ni de dag ni gsal ba dang kha phyir phyogs pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dag ni dga' ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa dag go zhes bya ba ni de dag ni gsal ba dang kha phyir phyogs pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Greed and pride are said to operate with a joyful mode, because they are clear and extroverted.

original: rags pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rags pa yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are also said to be gross.

original: de dag dang the tshom yang ste /
analyzed: de dag dang the tshom yang ste /
translated: They and doubt

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa la 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa la 'gyod pa'o //
translated: are remorse about the certain and the uncertain.

original: de dang lta ba dang dga' ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa rno ba yang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang lta ba dang dga' ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa rno ba yang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They and the views operate with a joyful mode and are sharp. This is the meaning.

original: 'gyod pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Remorse is not like that.

original: de ni legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i gnas la 'jug go //üîΩlta ba rnams dang yang de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i gnas la 'jug go // lta ba rnams dang yang de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: It operates on the basis of good conduct and bad conduct.üîΩThe views are not like that.

original: de rnams dang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not like that.

original: zhan pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa ni log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhan pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa ni log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not engage its object with a weak aspect, because it is not concomitant with wrong view.

original: de'i phyir rgyu gnyis kho na nges par gzung rigs ba las so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gnyis kho na nges par gzung rigs ba las so //
translated: Therefore it is logical to hold that only two causes are definite.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gyod pa mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa nyid kyis tshogs su nges @191b so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gyod pa mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa nyid kyis tshogs su nges @191b so zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //
translated: For that very reason, the master Samghabhadra says that any nonvirtuous regret is definitely concomitant with all ten mental factors.

original: kun la mi 'gal bar grub pa'i phyir lta ba dang ldan pa la nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun la mi 'gal bar grub pa'i phyir lta ba dang ldan pa la nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is established that it is not incompatible with any, it becomes twenty one when concomitant with view.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kho na nges par gzung rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kho na nges par gzung rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Therefore is it not logical to hold that it is definite?

original: gang zhig gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyes par gzung ba na /
analyzed: gang zhig gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyes par gzung ba na /
translated: When regret is concomitant with sleep,

original: 'gyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma 'dres pa 'di nyid kyang nges par gzung ba mi 'gal te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma 'dres pa 'di nyid kyang nges par gzung ba mi 'gal te /
translated: it is logical to hold that this nonvirtuous regret alone is definite.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang ma 'dres pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid do snyam du 'di ltar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang ma 'dres pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid do snyam du 'di ltar bsam pa'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are also concomitant only with the specific ones.

original: de'i phyir dang gi sgra ni 'dir kun sdud pa'i don nyid mtshon par byed do ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dang gi sgra ni 'dir kun sdud pa'i don nyid mtshon par byed do ;
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúand‚Äù in the root text indicates that all the others are included.

original: / shes rab kyi khyad par gzung ba ni lta ba ma yin pa'i shes rab gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / shes rab kyi khyad par gzung ba ni lta ba ma yin pa'i shes rab gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific distinction of wisdom is mentioned in order to clarify the wisdom that is not view.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection and extreme views would not follow.

original: mi dge ba'i rnam pa las nyon mongs bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam pa las nyon mongs bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Four afflictions and secondary afflictions arise from the unwholesome states.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: Twenty-one are produced from the unwholesome states.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: But not only twenty-one.

original: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sleep is not incompatible with any of the others.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang khro ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de la ni ma 'dres par bshad pa nyi shu dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang 'gyod pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa rnams las gang rung ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang khro ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de la ni ma 'dres par bshad pa nyi shu dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang 'gyod pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa rnams las gang rung ba'o //
translated: It is associated with the twenty indeterminate mental factors, and with any of the defilements, secondary defilements, and regret, as previously explained.

original: bsgribs la bco brgyad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgribs la bco brgyad ces bya ba la /
translated: Obscured indeterminate mental factors are of eighteen kinds.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems te /
translated: In the realm of desire, the mind associated with the afflicted view of the self and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme.

original: de la ni gdon mi za bar bco brgyad 'byung gi /
analyzed: de la ni gdon mi za bar bco brgyad 'byung gi /
translated: In this case, eighteen mental factors are necessarily present.

original: bco brgyad kho na'o zhes nges par ni mi gzung ste /
analyzed: bco brgyad kho na'o zhes nges par ni mi gzung ste /
translated: But it is not certain that there are only eighteen,

original: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because sleep is not incompatible with any of the other mental factors.

original: lung ma bstan gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lung ma bstan gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod ces bya ba la /
translated: The other indeterminate mental factors are held to be of twelve kinds.

original: 'dir yang gnyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang gnyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du nges par gzung ngo //
translated: Here, too, sleep is not incompatible with any of the others, so the number is not fixed as twelve.

original: nyi 'og pa dag ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /üîΩgang dag yid mi bde ba yang yid bde ba dang 'dra bar lung du ma bstan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa dag ni zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la / gang dag yid mi bde ba yang yid bde ba dang 'dra bar lung du ma bstan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The AparƒÅntakas say:üîΩThose who assert that mental dissatisfaction is neutral like mental satisfaction.

original: de la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir yid la gcags ba gang yin pa de 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan te /
analyzed: de la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir yid la gcags ba gang yin pa de 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan te /
translated: Here, regret is neutral when it is neutral because it is neutral by nature.üîΩWhy did I not listen?

original: ngas ma zhu bar ci'i phyir thos zhes bya ba'am rtsig pa @192a * //
analyzed: ngas ma zhu bar ci'i phyir thos zhes bya ba'am rtsig pa @192a * //
translated: Why did I not break through the wall?

original: de ci ste ma bral snyam du yid la gcags pa de ci ltar lung ma bstan du mi 'gyur snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de ci ste ma bral snyam du yid la gcags pa de ci ltar lung ma bstan du mi 'gyur snyam pa'o //
translated: Why did I not get out?

original: kha che ba rnams na re 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan pa med do /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan pa med do /
translated: The Kasmiri Vaibhasikas say: There is no neutral regret.

original: yid mi bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la med pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la med pa'i phyir zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is associated with mental dissatisfaction and because it does not exist for those free from attachment.

original: ma bsgribs la zhes gong du smos pa la /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la zhes gong du smos pa la /
translated: The above statement that it is unobscured

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //

analyzed: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal phyir //

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /

analyzed: gnyid log pa la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir gnyid ni de dag dang mi 'gal lo //

analyzed: gang la nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /

analyzed: sems mngon par spro ba ni brtson 'grus te nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir le lo ma yin no //

original: gang yang cung zad mi dge ba //
analyzed: gang yang cung zad mi dge ba //

original: yon tan rnams zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'di la bkur ba med pas na bkur ba med @194a * //

analyzed: 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba med pa ni 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba ste /

analyzed: de'i dngos po ni 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid do //

analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos yid kyis byas te /

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yang dbang du 'gyur gyi /

original: mi 'jigs pa ni ma yin no //

original: / gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: / gzhan dag na re /

original: slar gshe ba dang spangs pa'o //
analyzed: slar gshe ba dang spangs pa'o //

analyzed: de'i smad pa dang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba ste /

analyzed: de la 'jigs par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o //

analyzed: aa n'asthe dyarshba  : 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na skrag pa la grags so //

original: 'bras bu mi @194b 'jigs par lta ba yin na ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi @194b 'jigs par lta ba yin na ni /

analyzed: gal te mi 'dod ba'i 'bras bu 'jigs par mi lta ba yin na ni /

analyzed: mi lta ba ni ma rig pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba la /

original: shes pa dang log pa'i shes ba dag kun tu spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod ba de ni khrel med pa ste /

translated: Shamelessness and nonembarrassment are the causes for engaging in both knowledge and wrong knowledge.üîΩThey are called secondary mental afflictions.

analyzed: kha na ma tho ba kun tu spyod pa dogs pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are the causes for engaging in both knowledge and wrong knowledge.üîΩOthers say:

translated: Shamelessness is the non-disdain for one‚Äôs own faults,üîΩnonembarrassment is the non-disdain for the faults of others.

analyzed: mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir sems gcig la gnyi ga 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de lta na yang bltos pa gnyis zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //

original: gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag ni cig car bltos par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag nyid dag ni cig car bltos par mi rigs te /

analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //

original: bdag dang gzhan la bltos pa cig car ro zhes ni mi zer ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la bltos pa cig car ro zhes ni mi zer ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: rnam grangs kyi 'jug par 'dod pas de dag cig car 'jug par mi 'dod pas skyon med do //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi 'jug par 'dod pas de dag cig car 'jug par mi 'dod pas skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault, because we do not assert that they function simultaneously, since we accept that they function in sequence.

original: bdag nyid la bltos nas nyes pa de dag la mi 'dzem pa ngo tsha med pa dang / gzhan la bltos nas ni khrel med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid la bltos nas nyes pa de dag la mi 'dzem pa ngo tsha med pa dang / gzhan la bltos nas ni khrel med pa ste /

original: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la brten yang de rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la brten yang de rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /

analyzed: 'di mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi brtsi bas de ltar bsam pa'o zhes zer ro //

original: gzhan dag na re nyon mongs pa rnam par smad pa las khral med pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nyon mongs pa rnam par smad pa las khral med pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: ‚ÄúIt is the lack of fear of the afflictions.‚Äù

analyzed: gzhan dag ni gcig pu nyes par spyod pa la mi 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha med pa dang / tshogs kyi nang du zhugs pa las khrel med pa'o zhes so //
translated: Others say: Shamelessness is the lack of embarrassment about one‚Äôs own misdeeds, while lack of conscience is the lack of embarrassment about one‚Äôs misdeeds in the presence of others.

analyzed: kha cig ni mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kun tu spyod pa @195a * //
translated: Some say: Shamelessness is the cause of the karmic maturation of nonvirtue.

original: bltos pa med pa ni khrel med pa'o zhes so //üîΩthams cad kyang mi dge ba'i sems kun tu spyod pa rgyu dang 'bras bu la bltos pa med pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di dag sems gcig la yang 'gyur ro zhes so //

translated: Lack of conscience is the lack of regard for cause and effect.üîΩSince all of these are the conduct of nonvirtuous minds that lack regard for cause and effect, they occur in a single mind.

original: re zhig rtog pa dang po ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'dis gnon cing spyod par byed pas na gus pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig rtog pa dang po ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / 'dis gnon cing spyod par byed pas na gus pa'o //
translated: If the first theory is correct, then shamelessness and the others would not exist in a single mind.

original: gus pa'i dngos po ni gus pa nyid de /
analyzed: gus pa'i dngos po ni gus pa nyid de /

original: de ni yul dang / rgyu mtshan gyi gces spras te /
analyzed: de ni yul dang / rgyu mtshan gyi gces spras te /

original: 'di ni yul gyi bdun pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni yul gyi bdun pa'am /
translated: This is the seventh case of an object or

analyzed: gus pa dang lhan cig gus pa dang bcas pa ste nor dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: and respect is the possession of respect, like the possession of wealth.

analyzed: de'i dngos po ni gus pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: The state of that is the state of being possessed of respect.

analyzed: gang zhig yod na bla ma'i gnas rnams dang / yon tan rnams las 'da' bar mi nus pa sems las byung ba'i chos so //
translated: It is a mental factor that, when it exists, one cannot transgress the gurus, the bases of respect, and the virtues.

analyzed: chos gang dang ldan pas bkur ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba de ni bkur pa dang bcas pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ni dbang sgyur gyi /

original: kha na ma tho ba dag la zhes bya ba ni gang dang 'brel pa las 'jigs pas dbang sgyur bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩrtog pa gnyis pa ltar na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /

original: bdag la bltas nas nyes pa dag la 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag la bltas nas nyes pa dag la 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa yin la /
translated: If the second conception is correct, then shame is the avoidance of faults by observing oneself,

original: gzhan la bltos nas ni khrel yod pa'o //

original: lhan cig mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig mi 'gal ba'o //

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la ma rmongs pas dge ba'i sems kun tu @195b spyod pa thams cad la sdug bsngal yongs su bsgom pa la sogs pa ste sems gcig la yang khrel yod pa 'byung ngo snyam du sems so //

translated: Since he is not confused about cause and effect, he is ashamed of all his unwholesome thoughts and deeds, and he thinks, ‚ÄúI will cultivate the meditation on suffering, etc., in regard to even a single thought.‚Äù

analyzed: dga' dang zhes bya ba ni dga' ba nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la bsams nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúJoy‚Äù is mentioned with reference to non-defiled joy.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúJoy is of two kinds:

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o zhes rgya cher smos so //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de ni dad pa ste zhes bya ba la dad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //

analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa ni 'ga' zhig la 'dod pa skye ste /

analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa'i dad pa'o // gnyis ka ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa yang ma yin la /

translated: The other mental factors and the dissociated factors, etc., are not included among those modes of faith and joy that have the truths of cessation and path as their object, nor among those that have sons, etc., as their object.

original: chos la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i slob ma ni lhan cig gnas @196a * //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i slob ma ni lhan cig gnas @196a * //

original: pa'o ; / rig pa la sogs pa blangs pa dang 'brel pa ni nye gnas so //üîΩrnam pa de dag ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa dang / yon tan med pa dang / 'jig rten gzhan gang yin pa ste /

translated: One who is related to the teacher by taking up the Vedas, etc., is a pupil.üîΩExcept for those modes is except for those modes of faith and joy that are related to the teacher by the Dharma, etc., and those that are related to the teacher by taking up the Vedas, etc.

original: de la ni dga' ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de la ni dga' ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Those that are not related, those that are not virtues, and those that are in another world are neither faith nor joy.

original: ma gus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma gus pa yang ma yin no //

original: gzhan dag na yon tan yod do snyam pa ni dad pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na yon tan yod do snyam pa ni dad pa yin la /
translated: Others say: Faith is the belief that the other person has good qualities.

original: de'i sgo nas dga' ba skye ste /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas dga' ba skye ste /
translated: Joy is produced on the basis of that belief.

original: de'i phyir dga' ba ni dad pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi dad pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re gus pa ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba ni dad pa'i 'bras bu yin gyi dad pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro // gzhan dag na re gus pa ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, joy is the result of faith, but faith is not the result of joy.

original: gus pa'i 'bras bu 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa yin gyi gus pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩ'di dag la ngo tsha shes pa ni gus pa las skye la /
analyzed: gus pa'i 'bras bu 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha shes pa yin gyi gus pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer ro // 'di dag la ngo tsha shes pa ni gus pa las skye la /
translated: Others say: Shame is the result of respect, but it is not respect itself.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa'i sngon du 'dzem pa skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa'i sngon du 'dzem pa skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Shame arises from respect, but shame does not arise prior to respect.

original: de gnyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dag na zhes bya ba nges par gzung ba'i don du brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis 'dod pa dang gzugs dag na zhes bya ba nges par gzung ba'i don du brtsams pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúThese two exist in the desire realm and the form realm‚Äù is stated to specify that they exist in those realms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na ni dga' ba dang gus pa dag med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na ni dga' ba dang gus pa dag med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚ÄúJoy and respect do not exist in the formless realm.‚Äù

original: de dag med pa'i rgyu ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i rgyu ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the reason that they do not exist there?

original: dga' ba dang gus pa'i rten med pa dang de dag gi rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang gus pa'i rten med pa dang de dag gi rgyu med pa'o //
translated: because there is no basis for joy and respect and because there is no cause for them.

original: rten ni slob dpon dang slob ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten ni slob dpon dang slob ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis is the master and the disciple, etc.

original: de la slob ma rnams ni slob dpon la dga' ba dang / gus pa yin la /
analyzed: de la slob ma rnams ni slob dpon la dga' ba dang / gus pa yin la /
translated: Disciples have joy and respect for the master.

original: slob dpon rnams ni slob ma rnams la dga' ba kho na yin gyi gus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams ni slob ma rnams la dga' ba kho na yin gyi gus pa ma yin no //
translated: Masters have joy for disciples, but not respect.

original: rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las dag pa dang 'dris pa yin no //üîΩde gnyi ga yid gzugs med pa dag ni med do //
analyzed: rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las dag pa dang 'dris pa yin no // de gnyi ga yid gzugs med pa dag ni med do //
translated: The cause is pure action of body and speech and familiarity.üîΩBoth joy and respect are absent in the formless realm because there is no body or speech there.

original: de'i phyir dga' ba dang gus pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba dang gus pa med do //
translated: Therefore, joy and respect are absent there.

original: dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Faith and shame are explained in the same way.

original: dga' ba dang / gus pa gnyis ni dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / gus pa gnyis ni dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Joy and respect are by nature faith and shame.

original: dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs med par bkag pa 'gal lo zhe na dad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs med par bkag pa 'gal lo zhe na dad pa ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Faith and conscience are not contradictory to the formless realm, because they are virtuous mental factors that are common to all minds.üîΩFaith is of two types.

original: der ni gang zag la dmigs pa dad pa ngo tsha shes pa dag bkag gi chos la dmigs pa dag ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: der ni gang zag la dmigs pa dad pa ngo tsha shes pa dag bkag gi chos la dmigs pa dag ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Faith and conscience that focus on persons are contradictory to the formless realm, but those that focus on phenomena are not contradictory.

original: 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skabs kyis te /
analyzed: skabs kyis te /
translated: It is due to the context.

original: @196b gang zag dag la dga' ba dang gus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
analyzed: @196b gang zag dag la dga' ba dang gus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs yin no //
translated: The context is that faith and conscience are fondness and respect for persons.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir ni dga' ba dang gus pa de dag la bsams pa yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir ni dga' ba dang gus pa de dag la bsams pa yin no // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, here, faith and conscience are intended as fondness and respect for persons.

original: gang dag gang zag dag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dag la yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag gang zag dag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dag la yin gyi /
translated: Faith and conscience that focus on persons are contradictory to the formless realm,

original: chos la dmigs pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: but those that focus on phenomena are not contradictory.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that investigation and analysis are contradictory to the fourth absorption.

original: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can those two be present in a single mind?

original: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ma bstan pas sems gzhan nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ma bstan pas sems gzhan nyid ma yin la /
translated: Since their intrinsic natures have not been explained, they are not different minds.

original: sems gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid yod pa yang ma yin te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid yod pa yang ma yin te phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And it is not the case that grossness and subtlety exist in a single mind, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say: The passage continues:üîΩWhen butter is placed in water,

original: mar sar chu dag gi nang du bor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩbsgyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mar sar chu dag gi nang du bor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bsgyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is neither too hot nor too cold.

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir sems ha cang rtsing ba dang / ha cang zhib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dpe dang chos mtshungs pa'o //üîΩha cang yang mi 'khyag ces bya ba ni ha cang 'thas bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir sems ha cang rtsing ba dang / ha cang zhib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dpe dang chos mtshungs pa'o // ha cang yang mi 'khyag ces bya ba ni ha cang 'thas bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The example and the quality are similar, because the mind is not too gross or too subtle, since it is associated with investigation and analysis.üîΩIt is not too cold means it is not too frozen.

original: ha cang mi 'ju ba ni ha cang zhu bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang mi 'ju ba ni ha cang zhu bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is not too hot means it is not too melted.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: But they are not the reality of those things.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib ba nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib ba nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not by nature that, i.e., they are not by nature coarse or subtle.

original: gal te rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni sems kyi rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba'i sgo nas bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni sems kyi rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba'i sgo nas bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: If you accept that investigation and analysis are the coarseness and subtlety of mind, then this is taught from the perspective of their function.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin zhes ba khas len te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin zhes ba khas len te /
translated: But they are not taught from the perspective of their own nature,

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan du gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan du gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so the consequence that they are the reason for that is not entailed.

original: 'di ltar mdo las rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las rnam par shes pa gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Thus a sutra states: Any consciousness whatsoever

original: rags pa'am / phra ba'am zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rags pa'am / phra ba'am zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is either coarse or subtle.

original: de'i phyir chos gang yod na /üîΩsems rtsing bar skye ba de ni rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gang yod na / sems rtsing bar skye ba de ni rtog pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, when a certain phenomenon exists,üîΩmind arises as coarse and that is investigation.

original: gang yod na zhib par skye ba de ni dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod na zhib par skye ba de ni dpyod pa'o //
translated: When another exists, mind arises as subtle and that is analysis.

original: de lta na sa dang sems gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa gnyis mi 'thad de phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na sa dang sems gcig la rtsing ba dang zhib pa gnyis mi 'thad de phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, coarseness and subtlety are not tenable in a single mind and a single object, because they are mutually contradictory.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: sems gcig la dmigs shing rdzas mnyam yang mthu'i dus gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de /üîΩtshogs la rtog pa'i mthu bla lhag na ni dpyod pa @197a * //
analyzed: sems gcig la dmigs shing rdzas mnyam yang mthu'i dus gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med de / tshogs la rtog pa'i mthu bla lhag na ni dpyod pa @197a * //
translated: There is no contradiction, because although they are the same substance and focus on a single mind, they have different times of power.

original: nyams pa'i phyir sems rtsing bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyams pa'i phyir sems rtsing bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the power of investigation is superior in a collection, then analysis is weak and the mind becomes coarse.

original: dpyod pa'i mthu bla lhag na ni rtog pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir zhib par 'gyur te tshva dang chu grang bzhin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i mthu bla lhag na ni rtog pa'i mthu nyams pa'i phyir zhib par 'gyur te tshva dang chu grang bzhin no //
translated: If the power of analysis is superior, then the power of investigation is weak and the mind becomes subtle, like salt and cold water.

original: 'dir gang zhig mthu shas che ba de ni tshva dang mtshungs la /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig mthu shas che ba de ni tshva dang mtshungs la /
translated: Here, that which is superior in power is like salt,

original: gang zhig shas chung ba de ni chu dang mtshungs pas de las mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig shas chung ba de ni chu dang mtshungs pas de las mi mthun pa med do //
translated: and that which is weak is like water, so there is no contradiction.

original: de ltar na rtog pa dang dpyod pa cig car ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pa dang dpyod pa cig car ba yin la /
translated: Thus investigation and analysis are simultaneous,

original: sems rtsing ba nyid ni zhig pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems rtsing ba nyid ni zhig pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: but the coarseness of the mind is not destroyed.

original: rtsing ba dang zhib pas dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: rtsing ba dang zhib pas dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states:

original: de la sa'i bye brag gis mngon par 'du bya ba che ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la bltos nas 'dod pa'i khams rags la /
analyzed: de la sa'i bye brag gis mngon par 'du bya ba che ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la bltos nas 'dod pa'i khams rags la /
translated: The realm of desire is coarse in comparison to the first meditation, because the formative forces are great.

original: 'du bya ba la chung ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la bltos nas bsam gtan dang po phra zhing rab tu zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du bya ba la chung ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la bltos nas bsam gtan dang po phra zhing rab tu zhib pa yin no //
translated: The first meditation is subtle and very refined in comparison to the realm of desire, because the formative forces are small.

original: yang de nyid bsam gtan gnyis pa la bltos nas rags la /
analyzed: yang de nyid bsam gtan gnyis pa la bltos nas rags la /
translated: Moreover, that realm of desire is coarse in comparison to the second meditation,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa yang bsam gtan dang po la bltos nas phra ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa yang bsam gtan dang po la bltos nas phra ba yin te /
translated: and the second meditation is subtle in comparison to the first meditation.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated in the same way up until the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag gis ni sa gcig pa yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams las slar chung ngu la sogs par phye ba las /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag gis ni sa gcig pa yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams las slar chung ngu la sogs par phye ba las /
translated: In terms of the specific categories, even the same realm is divided into small, medium and great, and each of these is again divided into small and so on.

original: de ltar srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, up to the summit of cyclic existence, there would be investigation and analysis.

original: sa'i bye brag gis ni 'dod pa'i khams na rtog pa kho na yod la /
analyzed: sa'i bye brag gis ni 'dod pa'i khams na rtog pa kho na yod la /
translated: In the desire realm, there would be only investigation,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo na dpyod pa kho na yod cing bar na gnyis ka yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo na dpyod pa kho na yod cing bar na gnyis ka yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the summit of existence, there would be only analysis.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag gis ni sa thams cad na gnyis ka yod kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag gis ni sa thams cad na gnyis ka yod kyi /
translated: In terms of their specific types, both exist on all levels.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po gnyis kho na na yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po gnyis kho na na yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They exist in the desire realm and the first two absorptions, but not in the other levels.

analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' tshad mar byas pa nyid las 'dod pa yin no //

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang // sems can ma yin pa nam mkha' dang 'ga' yang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba dam bca' ba tsam ni rgol ba'i gzhi'o //

translated: They do not appear to be actions, like the eye, the ear, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs kyang 'bras bu las de gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par yod ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs kyang 'bras bu las de gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par yod ba nyid du rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Although the eye, etc. are not perceived by direct perception as to their own nature, because they are beyond the senses, they are inferred as existing separately from form, etc. because of their effect.

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang ldan pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs yod kyang long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa rnams la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang ldan pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs yod kyang long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa rnams la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skye la /
translated: Thus, even though there is form, attention, etc., the visual consciousness, etc. do not arise in the blind, the deaf, etc.

original: long ba la sogs pa dang bral na phyis skye ba yin no //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa dang bral na phyis skye ba yin no //
translated: But when they are separated from blindness, etc., they arise later.

original: de'i phyir gang la gnod pa byas pa dang / gnod pa ma byas pa las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma skye ba dang / slar skye bar 'gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i @204b rgyu gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la gnod pa byas pa dang / gnod pa ma byas pa las mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma skye ba dang / slar skye bar 'gyur pa gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i @204b rgyu gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that there is a cause other than form, etc., which is the cause of the non-arising of visual consciousness, etc., when harm is done to the eye, etc., and the cause of their arising when no harm is done.

original: thob pa ni rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pas mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: thob pa ni rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pas mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: Obtainment is not perceived by direct perception because its own nature is not perceived.

original: 'bras bu ma dmigs pas rjes su dpag bas gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma dmigs pas rjes su dpag bas gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it apprehended by inference because its effect is not perceived.

original: de'i phyir rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible that it is a substantial entity.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe ni dmag la sogs pa rnams so //üîΩskye ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe ni dmag la sogs pa rnams so // skye ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la /
translated: An example that is similar is an army, etc.

original: dngos po skye ba thob pa'i 'bras bus yin te /
analyzed: dngos po skye ba thob pa'i 'bras bus yin te /
translated: The cause of arising is the cause of the attainment of the arising of a thing.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa rnams kyang mig la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu la nges pas rdzas kyi chos las 'das pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma dmigs pa rnams kyang mig la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu la nges pas rdzas kyi chos las 'das pa med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even though the non-perceptions of their own natures are like the eye, etc., they are not beyond being substantial entities because they are ascertained by their effects.

original: 'dus ma byas kyis ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: It would not be unconditioned.

original: skye ba'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have the effect of arising.

original: de rnams la thob pa yod do zhes bya bar dngos po rnams kyi thob pa skye ba'i sgo nas rtog na ni /
analyzed: de rnams la thob pa yod do zhes bya bar dngos po rnams kyi thob pa skye ba'i sgo nas rtog na ni /
translated: If you imagine that the obtainment of things arises,

original: 'dus ma byas la skye ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' ltar thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pas 'dus ma byas kyis ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la skye ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' ltar thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pas 'dus ma byas kyis ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because unconditioned things do not arise, like space, there would be no inference of obtainment, and it would not be unconditioned.

original: chos gang dag ma thob pa rnams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag ma thob pa rnams dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Obtainment of those phenomena that are not obtained, and so on.

original: de la ma thob pa rnams ni sbyor ba las byung ba rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so //üîΩsa 'phos bas btang ba dag ni /
analyzed: de la ma thob pa rnams ni sbyor ba las byung ba rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so // sa 'phos bas btang ba dag ni /
translated: Obtainment of those phenomena that are not obtained refers to those that are derived from preparation and those that are free from mundane attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma ma yin pa rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma ma yin pa rnams te /
translated: Obtainment of those that are relinquished through changing level refers to those that are not afflicted.

original: de dag kyang dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Those are virtuous and unobscured neutral states.üîΩObtainment of those that are relinquished through obtaining their antidote refers to those that are afflicted.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas btang ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas btang ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams te /
translated: That which is relinquished through freedom from attachment is afflicted.

original: de dag kyang mi dge ba dang bsgribs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi dge ba dang bsgribs pa rnams so //
translated: Moreover, they are nonvirtuous and obscured.

original: skye ba'i rgyu thob pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu thob pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no obtainment of the cause of birth,

original: de dag ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te ;üîΩgang gi tshe sa gong ma nas 'chi 'phos nas sa 'og mar skye ba'am /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te ; gang gi tshe sa gong ma nas 'chi 'phos nas sa 'og mar skye ba'am /
translated: how could they arise?üîΩWhen one dies in the higher realms and is born in the lower realms,

original: de las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de las 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa de'i tshe /
translated: or when one degenerates from freedom from attachment to the lower realms,

original: thob pa med pas sa 'og ma'i chos rnams skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: thob pa med pas sa 'og ma'i chos rnams skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: then since there is no obtainment, dharmas of the lower realm do not arise.

original: thob pa lhan cig skye ba yin pa'i phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa lhan cig skye ba yin pa'i phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And since unobscured neutral states arise simultaneously with obtainment, they also would not arise.

original: de'i phyir thob pa med kyang skye ba mthong ba'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thob pa med kyang skye ba mthong ba'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is seen that they arise even though there is no obtainment, obtainment is not a result.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'i phyir thob pa rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas rdzas kyi chos mi srid pa son 'dug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu med pa'i phyir thob pa rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas rdzas kyi chos mi srid pa son 'dug go //
translated: Therefore, because there is no result, it is untenable that obtainment is an imputed existent, since it is not apprehended by inference.

original: 'on te lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i @205a * //
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i @205a * //
translated: Or is it the cause of obtainment that arises simultaneously with it?

original: rgyu can yin zhe na zhes bya ba la ma thob ba la sogs pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la sngar skyes pa'i thob pa med mod kyi lhan cig skyes pa ni yod de /
analyzed: rgyu can yin zhe na zhes bya ba la ma thob ba la sogs pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de dag la sngar skyes pa'i thob pa med mod kyi lhan cig skyes pa ni yod de /
translated: Obtainment of nonobtainment and so on does not exist prior to them, but it does exist simultaneously with them.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi skye ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ltar lhan cig skyes ba'i thob ba'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi skye ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ltar lhan cig skyes ba'i thob ba'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: Therefore, like their generation, their nonobtainment is unobscured and neutral and it is the cause of obtainment that arises simultaneously with it.

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang skye ba mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par smras pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang skye ba mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mi rigs par smras pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is illogical to state that they are called seen in arising.

original: de'i tshe skye ba'am zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba'am zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: At that time, what would arising do?

original: gal te chos lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyu can yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos lhan cig skyes pa'i rgyu can yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the cause of simultaneously arising phenomena, then at that time what would arising do?

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i 'bras bus thun mongs yin pa ni bskyed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i 'bras bus thun mongs yin pa ni bskyed pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the result of arising is common to all, it is that which generates.

original: gal te thob pa skyed par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thob pa skyed par byed pa yin na ni de'i tshe skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If obtainment generates that which is obtained, then what would arising do at that time?

original: gnas pa la sogs pa ltar de la byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa ltar de la byed pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like endurance and so on, it has no other function.

original: des na de yongs su brtags pa don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de yongs su brtags pa don med par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it would be pointless to impute arising.

original: yang na chos rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs par mi bya'o //üîΩci ste skye ba don med par 'gyur du 'ong bas de'i tshe na thob pas skye ba skyed bar byed la /
analyzed: yang na chos rnams lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs par mi bya'o // ci ste skye ba don med par 'gyur du 'ong bas de'i tshe na thob pas skye ba skyed bar byed la /
translated: Or else, you should not accept that dharmas are generated by obtainment that arises simultaneously with them.üîΩBut if you think that since it would be pointless for arising to exist, at that time obtainment generates arising and arising generates the dharma,

original: skye bas chos skyed bar byed do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod do snyam na /
analyzed: skye bas chos skyed bar byed do zhes bya ba de ltar 'dod do snyam na /
translated: and you assert that in this way,

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then in response to that, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe arising of arising.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang skye ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, as in the case of arising, you should state the same response.

original: yang na gal te thob pa'i chos skyed ba de ltar na skye ba'i thob pa yang skye bas skyed ces pa'i 'thad pa brjod par bya dgos te de ni skye bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur /üîΩskye ba nyid la chos mi mthun pa mngon par skye bas skyed pa de nyid kyis thob ba de skye na /
analyzed: yang na gal te thob pa'i chos skyed ba de ltar na skye ba'i thob pa yang skye bas skyed ces pa'i 'thad pa brjod par bya dgos te de ni skye bas ci zhig byed par 'gyur / skye ba nyid la chos mi mthun pa mngon par skye bas skyed pa de nyid kyis thob ba de skye na /
translated: Or, if you say that the obtainment of that which is generated by arising is generated by arising, then you must state a reason why the obtainment of arising is generated by arising, for what would arising do?üîΩIf that obtainment is generated by the arising of arising itself, then what would arising do?

original: de ni skye bas ci zhig byed skye ba'i skye ba yang zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de ni skye bas ci zhig byed skye ba'i skye ba yang zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: You must say that the arising of arising is generated by the arising of the arising of arising.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase completely bound by all bonds refers to

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa'o ;
translated: those who have not abandoned even one type of affliction.

original: / gang gi phyir thob pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par thob pa la khyad par med pa de'i phyir 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po skye ba khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir thob pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par thob pa la khyad par med pa de'i phyir 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po skye ba khyad par du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is no difference in the attainment of the obtainment of the result, therefore there is no difference in the arising of the small, medium, and great defilements of those who possess all the bonds.

original: de'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i thob pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i thob pa la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction in the obtainment that is the cause of that.

original: @205b gzhan dag na de ni rgyud gzhan la bltos na thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @205b gzhan dag na de ni rgyud gzhan la bltos na thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say: Because there is no distinction in obtainment in dependence on another mindstream.

original: 'di ltar 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa thams cad kyi thob pa rnams mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa thams cad kyi thob pa rnams mtshungs te /
translated: Thus the obtainment of all those who possess all the bonds is similar.

original: nyon mongs pa chung du'i chung du rnams kyis thob pa chung ngu'i chung ngu yin pa nas chen po'i chen po rnams kyis thob pa chen po'i chen po'i bar yin pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung du'i chung du rnams kyis thob pa chung ngu'i chung ngu yin pa nas chen po'i chen po rnams kyis thob pa chen po'i chen po'i bar yin pas /
translated: The obtainment of the small of the small defilements is small, and the obtainment of the great of the great is great.

original: thams cad kyis thob pa bye brag med kyang /
analyzed: thams cad kyis thob pa bye brag med kyang /
translated: Therefore, although there is no distinction in obtainment for all,

original: lhas byin la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po skye ba'i khyad par du ma la 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhas byin la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po skye ba'i khyad par du ma la 'gyur te /
translated: The distinction of weak, medium, and strong arising of the afflictions of Devadatta and so on would not occur.

original: rgyu la bye brag med na 'bras bu'i bye brag mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu la bye brag med na 'bras bu'i bye brag mi rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: If there is no distinction in the cause, it is illogical that there is a distinction in the effect.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa smos pa ni 'ching ba dang bral ba rnams la chung du la sogs pa'i khyad par du nyon mongs ba skye ba'i go skabs yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa smos pa ni 'ching ba dang bral ba rnams la chung du la sogs pa'i khyad par du nyon mongs ba skye ba'i go skabs yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement that he is bound by all bonds is made in order to show that there is no opportunity for the arising of weak and so on afflictions in those who are free from bonds.

original: ci ste thob pa la bye brag med kyang goms pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan las nyon mongs pa skye ba khyad par du 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste thob pa la bye brag med kyang goms pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan las nyon mongs pa skye ba khyad par du 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med snyam na /
translated: If you think that although there is no distinction in obtainment, the arising of the afflictions is distinguished due to other causes such as habituation, then there is no fault.

original: de'i phyir de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, if they are distinguished due to that.

original: goms pa'am gzhan las chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba de kho na las de dag skye la rag ste /
analyzed: goms pa'am gzhan las chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i bdag nyid can du 'gyur ba de kho na las de dag skye la rag ste /
translated: They arise from that alone, since they are cultivated or become small, medium, or great in dependence on other conditions.

original: rgyu gzhan gang zhig las nyon mongs pa'i khyad par yongs su brtags pa de kho nas nyon mongs pa rnams chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid du skye la rag mod /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang zhig las nyon mongs pa'i khyad par yongs su brtags pa de kho nas nyon mongs pa rnams chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid du skye la rag mod /
translated: It is possible that the distinctions of affliction arise from other causes, since they are thoroughly examined, and that afflictions arise as small, medium, and great.

original: thob pa don gzhan du gyur pa yongs su brtags ba ci dgos /
analyzed: thob pa don gzhan du gyur pa yongs su brtags ba ci dgos /
translated: But what need is there to imagine that obtainment is a different object?

original: de skad dus su zer zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de skad dus su zer zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: What would be the point of that?

original: rnam par gzhag pa ni nges ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni nges ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of the term is the cause of ascertainment.

original: re zhig so so skye bo rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa rnams ni zag pa med pa'i lam mngon du gyur pa'i tshe 'jig rten las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa smos so //
analyzed: re zhig so so skye bo rnams ni 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa dang / 'phags pa rnams ni zag pa med pa'i lam mngon du gyur pa'i tshe 'jig rten las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa smos so //
translated: Ordinary beings possess mundane minds, and ƒÅryas possess supramundane minds when the uncontaminated path is manifest.

original: yid ni yid nyid do //
analyzed: yid ni yid nyid do //
translated: Mind is the nature of mind.

original: lam mngon sum du gyur ba'i tshe ni thob pa med par 'phags pa dang so so skye bo'i rnam par gzhag par bya bar nus te /
analyzed: lam mngon sum du gyur ba'i tshe ni thob pa med par 'phags pa dang so so skye bo'i rnam par gzhag par bya bar nus te /
translated: When the path is manifest, one can be classified as an ƒÅrya or an ordinary being without having obtained it,

original: lam nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'jig @206a * //üîΩrten pa'i yid dang ldan pa rnams la ni thob pa med par 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams so //
analyzed: lam nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // 'jig @206a * // rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa rnams la ni thob pa med par 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams so //
translated: because the path itself is the cause of the classification.

original: 'di dag ni so so skye bo rnams so zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni so so skye bo rnams so zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If one possesses a mundane mind, one cannot be classified as an ƒÅrya or an ordinary being without having obtained it.

original: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i lam gyi thob pa yod pa dang ; de med pa ni 'phags pa dang so so skye bo rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i lam gyi thob pa yod pa dang ; de med pa ni 'phags pa dang so so skye bo rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore it is certain that the existence or nonexistence of the obtainment of the uncontaminated path is the cause of the classification of ƒÅryas and ordinary beings.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas kyi chos mi srid pas mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that it is impossible because substantial phenomena are impossible, because that does not exist.

original: thob pa ni chos thob zin pa chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / thob pa 'di ni 'di'o zhes shes pa'i rtags mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa ni chos thob zin pa chud mi za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / thob pa 'di ni 'di'o zhes shes pa'i rtags mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and possession is the cause of the non-disappearance of the possession of a dharma that has been obtained, and it is the sign of the knowledge that this possession is this.

original: ci 'o na 'di las gzhan ma yin pa dang 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar ming gzhan gyis brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci 'o na 'di las gzhan ma yin pa dang 'bras bu yod pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar ming gzhan gyis brjod ce na /
translated: But if it is not something other than that, how can it be called a cause, since it is defined as existing when the effect exists?

original: chud mi za ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin pa shes pa'i rtags mtshan du gyur ba yang mi rigs te /

analyzed: 'bad de skye ba rnams ni gang dag skye ba la mi bltos par sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'thob pa'o //
translated: Those that arise with effort are those that are obtained by the specific application that does not rely on birth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag skye bas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag skye bas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /

original: gang dag skyes pa nyid kyis 'thob kyi 'bad rtsol gzhan la mi bltos pa de dag ni skye bas 'thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag skyes pa nyid kyis 'thob kyi 'bad rtsol gzhan la mi bltos pa de dag ni skye bas 'thob pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are obtained merely by being born and do not rely on other efforts are obtained by birth.

original: 'dir skye ba ni ci rigs par srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / skye ba'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir skye ba ni ci rigs par srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / skye ba'i srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'o //
translated: Here, birth is the linking of the intermediate existence and the linking of the existence at birth.

original: gang dag sbyor ba'i khyad par la rag las te skye ba de dag ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag sbyor ba'i khyad par la rag las te skye ba de dag ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Those that arise in dependence on the specific preparation are the result of preparation.

original: de dag gis sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas pa'i phyir zhes @208a * //
analyzed: de dag gis sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas pa'i phyir zhes @208a * //
translated: Because they do not destroy the seed state.

original: bya ba la de dag gi sgra ni ma 'bad par skye ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bya ba la de dag gi sgra ni ma 'bad par skye ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúthem‚Äù refers to those that arise without effort.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa rnams la ni log par lta ba med pa'i phyir de dag gis sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas pas ma 'bad bar skyes pa rnams dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad par ldan no
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad pa rnams la ni log par lta ba med pa'i phyir de dag gis sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas pas ma 'bad bar skyes pa rnams dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu ma chad par ldan no
translated: Those who have not severed the wholesome roots possess those that arise without effort because they do not destroy the seed state through wrong views.

original: zhes bya'o ; ; sa bon gyi dngos po de gang dag gis nyams par byed ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya'o ; ; sa bon gyi dngos po de gang dag gis nyams par byed ce na /
translated: By what are the seed states destroyed?

original: de'i phyir de nyams pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyams pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúTheir destruction is by that and by severing the roots.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rtsa ba gtan du yang dag par bcom pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rtsa ba gtan du yang dag par bcom pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How do we know that the roots of virtue have not been completely and totally destroyed?

original: yang dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir dang sa bon kun tu chad pa rnams yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir dang sa bon kun tu chad pa rnams yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the roots of virtue are reconnected and because those whose seeds have been completely severed can arise again.üîΩA sutra also says,

original: mdo las kyang dge slong dag lhas byin gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor ba nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las kyang dge slong dag lhas byin gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor ba nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, Devadatta‚Äôs roots of virtue were reconnected.‚Äù

original: gang yang ji skad du dge slong dag gang ngas lhas byin gyi rgyud la dge ba'i chos skra'i rtse mo tsam yang ma gzigs te ;
analyzed: gang yang ji skad du dge slong dag gang ngas lhas byin gyi rgyud la dge ba'i chos skra'i rtse mo tsam yang ma gzigs te ;
translated: Also, it is said, ‚ÄúMonks, I do not see even the tip of a hair of virtue in Devadatta‚Äôs continuum.

analyzed: lhas byin de ngas dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa sdig pa can du lung bstan to zhes gsungs so //
translated: Devadatta was declared by me to have severed his roots of virtue and to be a sinner.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gang zag de la dge ba'i chos rnams mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag de la dge ba'i chos rnams mi mngon par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, virtuous phenomena do not appear in that person.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: de la dag pa'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa rdul dang mnyam pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: de la dag pa'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa rdul dang mnyam pa zhig yod de /

original: de'i de yang dus gzhan du thams cad kyi thams cad du 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de'i de yang dus gzhan du thams cad kyi thams cad du 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs she na /

analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du mngon du mi rgyu ba'i dngos po med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as referring to the nonexistence of things that never manifest in any way.

original: gang dag 'bad de skye ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste skye ba'i dbang nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag 'bad de skye ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste skye ba'i dbang nyid do //
translated: Those that arise through effort are called ‚Äúarisen from exertion‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?
