analyzed: de las skyes shing de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa'i khyad bar zhig ste de la thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is a specific potency that arises from that and is its cause, because it is unobstructed.

original: gegs ma byas pa'i phyir de dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: gegs ma byas pa'i phyir de dag dang ldan no //
translated: Because it does not create obstacles, it is possessed.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sa bon kho na rtsa nas bton pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sa bon kho na rtsa nas bton pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, here it is said that the seed itself is uprooted.

original: de la rtsa nas ma bton pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: de la rtsa nas ma bton pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi sa bon no //
translated: The seeds of the afflicted that are not extracted by the supramundane path.

original: nyams par ma byas pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis de dag nyid kyi sa bon dang log par lta ba kun tu mi rgyu ba las dge ba skyes nas thob pa rnams kyi sa bon no //

translated: The seeds of those that are not destroyed by the mundane path and the seeds of those that are obtained from birth by the wholesome due to the non-operation of wrong views.

analyzed: dbang pa'i dus @208b na rgyas par gyur pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'bad de skye ba'i ste sa bon zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: The seeds that are expanded by the power of time refer to those that arise through effort.

original: rgyas par gyur pa ni rigs par brtson pas yang dang yang du bskyed pa las so //
analyzed: rgyas par gyur pa ni rigs par brtson pas yang dang yang du bskyed pa las so //
translated: Expansion is due to repeated generation through proper effort.

original: thogs pa ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir mi brtson pa'am /
analyzed: thogs pa ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir mi brtson pa'am /
translated: Obstruction is due to lack of effort to generate or due to wrong effort, etc.

original: log par brtson pa la sogs pa la sa bon zhes bya ba ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bos nges bar ma zin pa'i phyir 'dri pa'o //
analyzed: log par brtson pa la sogs pa la sa bon zhes bya ba ni ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni de'i rang gi ngo bos nges bar ma zin pa'i phyir 'dri pa'o //
translated: What is meant by seeds? This is asked because their intrinsic nature is not ascertained.

original: 'bras bu bskyed bar bya ba la zhes bya la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed bar bya ba la zhes bya la sogs pa la /

original: 'bras bu ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The effect is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral entities.

original: de la bskyed par bya ba la nus pa'i ming dang gzugs gang yin pa de ni de dag gi sa bon no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bskyed par bya ba la nus pa'i ming dang gzugs gang yin pa de ni de dag gi sa bon no zhes bya'o //

original: mngon sum mam brgyud pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon sum mam brgyud pas zhes bya ba la /

original: mngon sum ni bar med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ni bar med pa'o //

original: brgyud pa ni rgyun tu gtogs pa'i skad cig gzhan gyis bar chod pa'o //
analyzed: brgyud pa ni rgyun tu gtogs pa'i skad cig gzhan gyis bar chod pa'o //

original: yongs su 'gyur ba gzhan las khyad bar du gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba gzhan las khyad bar du gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i bye brag go //
translated: A transformation is a specific change.

original: de ni 'bras bu bskyed par byed pa'i nus pa zhig ste gang gi mjug thogs su 'bras bu skye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu bskyed par byed pa'i nus pa zhig ste gang gi mjug thogs su 'bras bu skye ba'o //
translated: That is the capacity to produce an effect, which is the immediate antecedent of the effect.

original: grangs can pa'i 'gyur ba las rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: grangs can pa'i 'gyur ba las rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to distinguish from the transformation of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, he says,

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is this transformation?‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúit would follow that there would be a different continuum.‚Äù

analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa'i rgyu las mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rgyud ces bya ba 'di yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis te /
translated: What is this continuum? The establishment of things is twofold:

original: don dam pa dang / btags pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / btags pa'o //
translated: ultimate and nominal.

original: de la gal te don dam pa rgyud du 'don na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te don dam pa rgyud du 'don na ni /
translated: If it is ultimate,

original: de lta na grangs can pa rnams dang khyad par med de /
analyzed: de lta na grangs can pa rnams dang khyad par med de /
translated: then there is no difference from the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas,

original: de dag gi ltar na yang rnam par gnas pa'i rdzas kyi gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na yang rnam par gnas pa'i rdzas kyi gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because for them also, the transformation of a substance that is a fixed entity is a transformation.

original: 'on te btags par 'dod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te btags par 'dod pa yin na ni /
translated: But if it is asserted to be nominal,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gyur pa nyid yin no snyam du shes par 'dod pas 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gyur pa nyid yin no snyam du shes par 'dod pas 'dri ba'o //
translated: then how is it that the one who desires to know asks the question, ‚ÄúWhat is this continuum?‚Äù

original: 'du byed dus gsum rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rnams so zhes gnyis ka smos pa ni lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa rnams kyang dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed dus gsum rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa rnams so zhes gnyis ka smos pa ni lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa rnams kyang dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúformations of the three times that are causes and results‚Äù is used because co-arisen formations are also things that are causes and results and because formations that are not causes and results also exist in the three times.

original: de ltar na 'du byed rgyun ma chad par 'jug pa rnams rgyud yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'du byed rgyun ma chad par 'jug pa rnams rgyud yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äúformations that are causes and results of the three times‚Äù indicates that a continuum is a series of formations that occurs without interruption.

original: rgyud kyi nye bar phan par gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams snga ma dang @209a * //
analyzed: rgyud kyi nye bar phan par gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams snga ma dang @209a * //
translated: The formations that are helpful to a continuum are the formations that occur in the past and future.

original: phyi mar mi 'dra bar skye ba ni rgyud gzhan du gyur pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi mar mi 'dra bar skye ba ni rgyud gzhan du gyur pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
translated: The fact that they occur in a manner that is different from the present is called ‚Äúthe transformation of the continuum.‚Äù

original: gang la tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang la tshogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which possesses a collection‚Äù is used in the root text because a continuum is a collection of formations that are causes and results.

original: gal te de la tshogs pa'i sa bon kho na rtsa nas ma bton pa dang / nyams par ma byas pa ni ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag bsgom par mi nus par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te de la tshogs pa'i sa bon kho na rtsa nas ma bton pa dang / nyams par ma byas pa ni ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag bsgom par mi nus par 'gyur zhing /
translated: But that is never possible, since the applications of mindfulness cannot be cultivated.

original: de'i phyir aa dhi b'a sa na ma ni r'a ka ra na me ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir aa dhi b'a sa na ma ni r'a ka ra na me ba /
translated: Therefore, the author of the Abhidharmako≈õa says:

original: de la tshogs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la tshogs pa dang ldan no //

original: de ltar sgras gsungs so zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de ltar sgras gsungs so zhes bya bar shes so //

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /

original: gal te skye ba'i rgyu'am rnam bar gzhag pa'i rgyu yang rung ste /üîΩrnam pa thams cad de rnam pa kun tu btags pa'i chos te btags (lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i rgyu'am rnam bar gzhag pa'i rgyu yang rung ste / rnam pa thams cad de rnam pa kun tu btags pa'i chos te btags (lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: If it is a cause of arising or a cause of designation,üîΩin every way, in all ways, it is a phenomenon that is designated, that is, it is established by the convention of designation.

original: nor bu'i 'byung gnas nyid do/) / ba'i tha snyad kyis rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'byung gnas nyid do/) / ba'i tha snyad kyis rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a source of jewels.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rgyus rdzas kyi chos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rgyus rdzas kyi chos ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a substantial phenomenon, as explained earlier.

original: phyis ni dgag ste mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis ni dgag ste mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Later, it is negated and is said to be not possessed.

original: gang sa bon dang ldan pa'i sgras brjod pa de dgag pa'o //
analyzed: gang sa bon dang ldan pa'i sgras brjod pa de dgag pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the seeds are not the same in substance as the aggregates.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /

analyzed: ming dang gzugs mtha' dag ma yin zhing re re ma yin par rigs mthun pa'i sa bon gyi ngo bor mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that the seeds are the essential nature of the aggregates of name and form, which are not all of the same type and are not individual seeds.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: btags pa'i rdzas su yod pas de'i phyir sa bon du mi rigs so //
translated: Because they are substantially existent as designations, it is not tenable that they are seeds.

original: gal te re re la yin na lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te re re la yin na lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If they are individual seeds, how could neutral form be the seed of virtuous phenomena?

original: rigs mthun pa'i ma yin yang dge ba'i mjug thogs su dge ba skyed pa'i sa bon med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i ma yin yang dge ba'i mjug thogs su dge ba skyed pa'i sa bon med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: And it would follow that even though they are not of the same type, a virtuous state would not be the seed that produces a virtuous state immediately after another virtuous state.

original: 'di yang thams cad ma 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yang thams cad ma 'brel ba ste /

original: rgyu'i rkyen rnams ni 'bras bu mtha' dag bskyed pa la rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen rnams ni 'bras bu mtha' dag bskyed pa la rgyu yin pas /

original: cis de dag btags par yod /
analyzed: cis de dag btags par yod /

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang dbang po'i rdul phra rab mang po la brten pa yin pas /
translated: Also, eye consciousness and so on are supported by many subtle particles of the sense faculty.

original: cis de dag btags par yod /
analyzed: cis de dag btags par yod /
translated: Why are they imputedly existent?

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi sa bon nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi sa bon nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Also, it is not asserted that neutral states are seeds of virtuous and nonvirtuous states.üîΩIf that were not so, then virtuous and nonvirtuous states would not arise from neutral consciousnesses.

original: de ma yin na gzhan du lung ma bstan gyi rnam par shes pa las dge ba dang mi dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na rigs mthun pa nyid la yang nus pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag gi /

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos ni ma yin no //

original: gal te yang ming dang gzugs thams @209b cad phan tshun bltos pas sa bon du brjod na zhes pa cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yang ming dang gzugs thams @209b cad phan tshun bltos pas sa bon du brjod na zhes pa cir 'gyur /
translated: If all name and form are called seeds because they mutually rely on each other, what is the problem?

original: 'on kyang ming dang gzugs nyid ji ltar srid pa bzhin 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi sa bon gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ming dang gzugs nyid ji ltar srid pa bzhin 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi sa bon gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: However, name and form alone are the seeds of conditioned phenomena, not others.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgongs pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir 'di la ston gyi tshogs nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa'i dgongs pa yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir 'di la ston gyi tshogs nye bar gnas so //
translated: Because they do not understand the intention of the treatise author, they say: ‚ÄúThe collection of the teacher‚Äôs words is present here.‚Äù

original: bshad pa de lta mod kyi nus pa'i khyad par de las dge ba 'am ma dge ba las spyi don gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: bshad pa de lta mod kyi nus pa'i khyad par de las dge ba 'am ma dge ba las spyi don gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di yang mi rigs te /
translated: We reply: Although that is so, it is not correct to say that the special potency is not different from the general meaning of virtue or nonvirtue.

original: dri ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the question is not tenable.

original: gang bshad pa nyid kyi ming dang gzugs ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: gang bshad pa nyid kyi ming dang gzugs ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: Name-and-form that is explained is the potency that produces the effect.

original: sa bon las nus pa gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon las nus pa gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The potency is not different from the seed.

original: ji skad bshad pa sems snga ma dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'i khyad par las nus pa'i khyad par gyi sems skye'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa sems snga ma dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'i khyad par las nus pa'i khyad par gyi sems skye'o //
translated: As explained, the mind arises from the special potency of intention that arises simultaneously with the previous mind.

original: de yang sa bon ni nus pa'i khyad par la mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: de yang sa bon ni nus pa'i khyad par la mi brjod kyi /
translated: That is not called the potency of the seed.

original: rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad bar las 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad bar las 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The effect is produced from the special transformation of the continuum.

original: de la gzhan nus pa'i khyad par dang sems gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan nus pa'i khyad par dang sems gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: In that, the special potency is not different from the other mind.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sems pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems kyi skad cig go //
analyzed: sems pa dang lhan cig pa'i sems kyi skad cig go //
translated: It is the moment of mind that is simultaneous with intention.

original: sems pa'i khyad par gyi stobs bskyed bas khyad par du gyur ba ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa ste sems gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni thob pa'i khyad par gyi chos bstan pa'i phyir zhes grag ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems pa'i khyad par gyi stobs bskyed bas khyad par du gyur ba ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa ste sems gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro // de ni thob pa'i khyad par gyi chos bstan pa'i phyir zhes grag ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The special power that is generated by the force of the special intention is the cause of another mind that is able to generate a result.üîΩIt is said that this is taught in order to demonstrate the special attainment.

original: grag go zhes pa ni thob pa'i khyad par sems pa ni /
analyzed: grag go zhes pa ni thob pa'i khyad par sems pa ni /
translated: The word it is said is used because the special attainment of intention

original: ri bong gi rva'i rna ba la brtags pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva'i rna ba la brtags pa bzhin te /
translated: is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: de'i rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes ma rangs bar mtshon pa'i don no //
analyzed: de'i rten med pa'i phyir ro zhes ma rangs bar mtshon pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning of it is said is that it is not approved because it has no basis.

original: thob pa'i rgyun la bltos te /
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyun la bltos te /
translated: In dependence on the continuum of attainment,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa rnams re re la yang thob pa gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa rnams re re la yang thob pa gsum gsum mo //
translated: past and so on are each of the three attainments.üîΩThis explanation is qualified by

original: bshad pa 'di ni dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas pa zhig ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ni dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bcas pa zhig ste /
translated: the statement:

original: lung bstan min thob lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: lung bstan min thob lhan cig skyes //
translated: Attainment of neutral states arises simultaneously.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement it is said is used because the special attainment of intentionüîΩis like the horn of a rabbit.

original: ji ltar zhen 'das pa rnams kyi sngar skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang dus phyis skyes pa'i thob pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhen 'das pa rnams kyi sngar skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang dus phyis skyes pa'i thob pa ste /
translated: How? Past states have obtainment that arises earlier, that arises simultaneously, and that arises later.

original: de yang skyes la 'gags pa ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang skyes la 'gags pa ni 'das pa'o //
translated: Obtainment that has arisen and ceased is past.

original: skyes la ma 'gags pa ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: skyes la ma 'gags pa ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: Obtainment that has arisen and not ceased is present.

original: dus phyis skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //üîΩda ltar byung ba rnams kyi sngar skyes pa ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dus phyis skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o // da ltar byung ba rnams kyi sngar skyes pa ni 'das pa'o //
translated: Obtainment that has not yet arisen is future.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni da ltar ba'o //
translated: Obtainment of present states is that which has arisen earlier and that which arises simultaneously.

original: dus phyis skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //üîΩma 'ongs pa skyes pa rnams kyi yang skyes la 'gags pa ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dus phyis skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o // ma 'ongs pa skyes pa rnams kyi yang skyes la 'gags pa ni 'das pa'o //
translated: Obtainment that has not yet arisen is future.

original: skyes la ma @210a * //
analyzed: skyes la ma @210a * //
translated: Obtainment of future states is that which has arisen and ceased, that which has arisen and not ceased, and that which has not yet arisen.

original: 'gags pa ni da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: Obtainment that has arisen and ceased is past.üîΩObtainment that has arisen and not ceased is present.

original: ma skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Obtainment that has not yet arisen is future.

original: de ltar na sngar skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang dus phyis skyes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum gsum mo zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar skyes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa dang dus phyis skyes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum gsum mo zhes kha cig go //
translated: Thus some say that there are three types: that which arises earlier, that which arises simultaneously and that which arises later.

original: skye ba med pa'i chos rnams la de ltar rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i chos rnams la de ltar rnam pa gsum du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the unconditioned, there is no such threefold division.

original: ci ste khams gong ma nas shi 'phos te skye ba na nyon mongs pa gang zhig mngon du gyur nas lhan cig skyes pa thob ce na /üîΩdge ba gzhan dang nyon mongs pa can rang gi sa ba sngar ldang ngo //
analyzed: ci ste khams gong ma nas shi 'phos te skye ba na nyon mongs pa gang zhig mngon du gyur nas lhan cig skyes pa thob ce na / dge ba gzhan dang nyon mongs pa can rang gi sa ba sngar ldang ngo //
translated: When one dies in the higher realms and is reborn in a lower realm, which affliction manifests and which is obtained?üîΩWhen one dies in a higher realm and is reborn in a lower realm, the affliction of the lower realm that is to be abandoned by seeing arises and is obtained.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan dang bor skye ba de'i tshe bsam gtan gyi yon tan las byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i thob pa rnams skye'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan dang bor skye ba de'i tshe bsam gtan gyi yon tan las byung ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i thob pa rnams skye'o //
translated: When one who is free from attachment to the desire realm is reborn in the first absorption, the obtainment of the qualities of the absorptions that arise in the past and future arises.

original: dge ba la sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The obtainment of virtue and so on is similar to that.

original: de ni dge ba la sogs pa re re la yang dge ba la sogs pa yin par 'gyur na ni mi rung ba de'i phyir go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni dge ba la sogs pa re re la yang dge ba la sogs pa yin par 'gyur na ni mi rung ba de'i phyir go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Objection: If the obtainment of virtue and so on is similar to that, it is not suitable for each of virtue and so on to be virtuous and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir thob pa chos dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag gi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir thob pa chos dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag gi /
translated: Objection: Why is obtainment established to be similar to its object?

original: de lta ma yin par chos las bzlog ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin par chos las bzlog ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, if you do not do this, you will be turning away from the Dharma.üîΩ

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan pa thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were otherwise, then it would follow that one who is free from attachment would possess nonvirtuous phenomena and that one whose root of virtue has been severed would possess virtuous phenomena.

original: de ltar na'o na thams cad du lung du ma bstan pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na'o na thams cad du lung du ma bstan pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then all would be indeterminate.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te //
translated: That is not so.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos ltar gzhan dag tu yang 'dra ba nyid thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos ltar gzhan dag tu yang 'dra ba nyid thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that other phenomena would be similar to indeterminate phenomena.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir chos nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi thob pa lam dang mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir chos nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi thob pa lam dang mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Objection: It follows that the obtainment of afflicted phenomena would not be incompatible with the path, because it is indeterminate.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo spangs pa ma yin pas chos dang 'dra ba kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo spangs pa ma yin pas chos dang 'dra ba kho nar 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of the afflictions is not abandoned, it is asserted that they are similar to phenomena.

original: der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Objection: The obtainment of those belonging to one‚Äôs own realm is not abandoned.üîΩObjection: The obtainment of those belonging to one‚Äôs own realm is not abandoned.

original: ldan pa ni ldan pa can la rag las pas khams gzhan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni khams gzhan ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa ni ldan pa can la rag las pas khams gzhan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni khams gzhan ba ma yin no //
translated: Since possession depends on the possessor, the possession of the other realms is not of the other realms.

original: de la re zhig 'dod pa'i khams su yang skyes pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyis ni 'dod pa rnams na spyod pa'o //üîΩgzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dod pa'i khams su yang skyes pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyis ni 'dod pa rnams na spyod pa'o // gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: First, those born in the desire realm possess desire realm states.üîΩThose born in the form and formless realms possess form and formless realm states.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzugs @210b na spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzugs @210b na spyod pa yin la /
translated: Those born in the form realm possess form realm states.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa sprul pa'i sems kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //üîΩgzugs med pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa can rnams kyis ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa sprul pa'i sems kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o // gzugs med pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa can rnams kyis ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: Those born in the desire realm possess desire realm states through the emanating mind.üîΩThose born in the formless realm possess formless realm states through afflicted states.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzugs med pa'i khams pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzugs med pa'i khams pa kho na'o //
translated: Those born in the formless realm possess formless realm states.

original: ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Those not included have four types.

original: zhes bya ba la zag pa med pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pas bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la zag pa med pa rnams ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pas bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: Uncontaminated states are not appropriated by craving for the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm.

original: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i ni khams gsum pa'i yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩde ni khams gsum pa'i rkyen mtshang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba'i dbang gis khams gsum pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i ni khams gsum pa'i yin no zhes bya ba la / de ni khams gsum pa'i rkyen mtshang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba'i dbang gis khams gsum pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The first possibility is the obtainment of nonanalytical cessation that is of the three realms.üîΩIt is obtained through the power of birth, since it is obtained through the power of the three realms alone,

original: gang dag gi rkyen mtshang bar 'gyur ba chos kyi dbang gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gi rkyen mtshang bar 'gyur ba chos kyi dbang gis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not through the power of phenomena, since it is obtained through the power of the three realms alone,

original: gzhan du na lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i chos rnams kyis so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa'i chos rnams kyis so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise it would follow that phenomena subsumed by the truth of the path would not possess analytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The second possibility is the obtainment of analytical cessation that is uncontaminated.üîΩThe third possibility is the obtainment of nonanalytical cessation that is uncontaminated.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni gzugs na spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni gzugs na spyod pa yin la /
translated: The fourth possibility is the obtainment of analytical cessation that is of the three realms.

original: gzugs med ba na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med ba na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa ste /
translated: That obtained by the path of the formless realm is of the formless realm.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la nges pa'o //
translated: This is certain for one who is not a noble being and is free from attachment.

original: 'jig rten pas ni 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas ni 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yang yin no //
translated: That obtained by a mundane path is both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pas thob pa'i ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pas thob pa'i ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: That obtained by an uncontaminated path is uncontaminated.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyis ni gnyen po nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bral ba'i thob pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyis ni gnyen po nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bral ba'i thob pa med do //
translated: There is no obtainment of freedom that is of the desire realm, because it is the antidote to the desire realm.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i ni zag pa med pa nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i ni zag pa med pa nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: That obtained by the truth of the path is uncontaminated.

original: de ni lam gzhan du ma gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir na chos kyi dbang kho nas thob pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lam gzhan du ma gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir na chos kyi dbang kho nas thob pa nges pa yin no //
translated: That is certain by the power of the Dharma alone, because it is not included in another path.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa ra sa ti lam 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid la ci ltar zag pa med pa zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa ra sa ti lam 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid la ci ltar zag pa med pa zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: Objection: Is the obtainment of analytical cessation uncontaminated, like the characteristics of conditioned states that are obtained by the path?

original: zag pa med pa'i lam 'dus byas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam 'dus byas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The uncontaminated path is conditioned.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa la lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo med do //üîΩso sor brtags pa @211a * //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa la lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo med do // so sor brtags pa @211a * //
translated: The treatise masters say: The obtainment of nonanalytical cessation does not have the nature of the path.üîΩObjection: Nonanalytical cessation is also a basis of uncontaminated states,

original: ma yin pa'i 'gog pa la yang ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams kyis zag pa med pa rnams kyang zag pa med pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i 'gog pa la yang ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams kyis zag pa med pa rnams kyang zag pa med pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba rgol ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: because it is a basis of uncontaminated states that are both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: zag pa med pa mngon du gyur ba'i thob pa so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa med pa mngon du gyur ba'i thob pa so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'am /
translated: Objection: The obtainment of uncontaminated states that manifest is nonanalytical cessation.

original: zag pa med pa so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i thob ba dag la zag pa med pa'i bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i thob ba dag la zag pa med pa'i bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment of uncontaminated states that is nonanalytical cessation is not an uncontaminated state.

original: rgyu'i ngo bor khas blangs pa'i tshul gyis so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'brel med do //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bor khas blangs pa'i tshul gyis so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'i thob pa ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'brel med do //
translated: Objection: It is illogical to say that the obtainment of analytical cessation is like the obtainment of nonanalytical cessation, because it is accepted that it is the cause of the uncontaminated state.

original: slob pa'i gang zag gi ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: slob pa'i gang zag gi ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The factors of those in training are the pure factors.

original: mi slob pa'i ni mi slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ni mi slob pa rnams so //
translated: The factors of those beyond training are the factors of those beyond training.

original: de la re zhig slob pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir slob pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig slob pa'i chos rnams kyi thob pa ni slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir slob pa kho na yin no //
translated: First, the acquisition of the factors of those in training is of those in training, because it is included in the path of those in training.

original: de bzhin du mi slob pa'i rnams kyang rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi slob pa'i rnams kyang rig bar bya'o //
translated: The same for the factors of those beyond training.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: The factors that are neither of those in training nor of those beyond training are the factors that are associated with impurity and the unconditioned factors, because they are not included in the path of those in training or of those beyond training.

original: re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi thob pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa mi srid bas slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin no //üîΩ'dus ma byas kyis ni 'ga' zhig slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi thob pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa mi srid bas slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin no //üîΩ'dus ma byas kyis ni 'ga' zhig slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin la /
translated: First, the acquisition of the factors that are associated with impurity is not of those in training or of those beyond training, because it is not possible for it to be of those in training or of those beyond training.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not of those in training or of those beyond training, because they are not included in the path of those in training or of those beyond training.

original: gang zhig gi ni rnam pa gsum yin pas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig gi ni rnam pa gsum yin pas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: since acquisition and non-acquisition do not exist simultaneously, it is illogical that the non-acquisition of the present is not present.

original: 'dod sogs gtogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dod sogs gtogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those belonging to the desire realm and so on

original: 'dod pa la sogs par gtogs pa rnams ni 'dod sogs gtogs te 'dod pa dang mi ldan ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs par gtogs pa rnams ni 'dod sogs gtogs te 'dod pa dang mi ldan ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: Those belonging to the desire realm and so on are those belonging to the desire realm and so on, meaning they are not not belonging to the desire realm.

original: ma thob pa ni skye ba'i rten gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi ;
analyzed: ma thob pa ni skye ba'i rten gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi ;
translated: Non-acquisition is posited by the power of the basis of birth.

original: chos kyi dbang gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang gis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the power of the factors,

original: chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in contradiction with the factors.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes ba'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su skyes ba'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The nonacquisition of the realm of desire is of those who are born in the realm of desire, the realm of finemateriality, and the immaterial realm.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba rnams dang / dge @213a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba rnams dang / dge @213a * //
translated: Those who are born in the realm of desire possess the nonacquisition of the wholesome factors of the realm of desire that are obtained through preparatory effort,

original: ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pas skyes nas thob pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med ban spyod pa rnams las nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pas skyes nas thob pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med ban spyod pa rnams las nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: those that are obtained from birth by those who have cut off the wholesome roots, and those of the realm of finemateriality and the immaterial realm.üîΩThey possess the nonacquisition of the unwholesome and nondetermined factors of the realm of desire, but not of the wholesome factors, because they are not free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams dang / so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: They possess the nonacquisition of the uncontaminated factors of the realm of desire, because they are ordinary beings.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no zhes rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no zhes rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, the nonacquisition of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, and of the phenomena of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, and of uncontaminated states, should be explained extensively.

original: ma thob pa chos kyi dbang gis rnam par mi bzhag go zhes bya ba 'dis shes par byed ba ni ma thob pa zag ba med pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa chos kyi dbang gis rnam par mi bzhag go zhes bya ba 'dis shes par byed ba ni ma thob pa zag ba med pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is understood from the statement, ‚ÄúNonacquisition is not established by the power of phenomena,‚Äù which means that there is no uncontaminated nonacquisition at all.

original: ma thob pa zag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di gang las rtogs she na bstan bcos las so //üîΩ'di ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bstan bcos nye bar 'god pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa zag pa med do zhes bya ba 'di gang las rtogs she na bstan bcos las so // 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bstan bcos nye bar 'god pa'o //
translated: From what is it understood that nonacquisition is uncontaminated? It is understood from the treatise.

original: 'dir bstan bcos ni ye shes la 'jug pa la mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos ni ye shes la 'jug pa la mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Here, the treatise is the Introduction to Knowledge.

original: so so'i skye po nyid ni zag pa med pa yin par mi 'os so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so'i skye po nyid ni zag pa med pa yin par mi 'os so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThe state of an ordinary being is not suitable to be uncontaminated.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: so so'i skye bo'i dngos po ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin na zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i dngos por rung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dngos po ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin na zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i dngos por rung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Because the state of an ordinary being is the nature of an ordinary being, and it is not tenable that uncontaminated states are the nature of an ordinary being,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyang so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyang so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then follow that ƒÅryas would be ordinary beings.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i bye brag dang / gang zag gi bye brag dang / gnyen po'i bye brag gis 'phags pa'i chos rnams mang ba'i phyir dang 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa'o zhes khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i bye brag dang / gang zag gi bye brag dang / gnyen po'i bye brag gis 'phags pa'i chos rnams mang ba'i phyir dang 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa'o zhes khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the ƒÅrya Dharma is numerous due to the specific distinctions of training and post-training, the specific distinctions of persons, and the specific distinctions of antidotes, and because it is stated without distinction that the nonacquisition of ƒÅrya dharmas is an ordinary being,

original: 'phags pa'i chos gang dag gis zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos gang dag gis zhes dris pa dang / de'i phyir /
translated: the root text asks, ‚ÄúBy which ƒÅrya dharmas?‚Äù

original: thams cad kyi yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and then responds, ‚ÄúBy all.‚Äù

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: This refers to the different types of ƒÅrya dharmas that are distinguished by the specific distinctions of training, post-training, and so on.

original: 'di gang las rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'di gang las rtogs she na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: de'i phyir / khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it is obtained without distinction.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the treatise.

original: gal te thams cad kyis ma rnyed ba so so'i skye bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyis ma rnyed ba so so'i skye bo nyid yin na /
translated: If all ordinary beings are those who have not obtained it,

original: de lta na thams cad kyis rnyed pa las 'phags pa yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na thams cad kyis rnyed pa las 'phags pa yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: then it follows that all of them would be ƒÅryas, since they have obtained it.

original: de lta na @213b 'ga' la yang zag pa med pa'i chos ma lus pa rnyed pa med pas 'phags pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na @213b 'ga' la yang zag pa med pa'i chos ma lus pa rnyed pa med pas 'phags pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: And if that is so, then it follows that no ƒÅryas would exist, since no one would obtain all uncontaminated states.üîΩTherefore it says,

original: de ni rnyed pa med pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa med pa gang yin pa de zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: that which is not obtained by anyone.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni thams cad kyis ma rnyed pa la brjod kyi /üîΩ'ga' zhig gis ma rnyed pa na ma yin la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni thams cad kyis ma rnyed pa la brjod kyi / 'ga' zhig gis ma rnyed pa na ma yin la /
translated: Ordinary being is said to be not obtained by all,üîΩbut it is not that it is not obtained by some.

original: 'phags pas ni 'ga' zhig dag ma rnyed pa yin pas de 'phags pa ma yin ba nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pas ni 'ga' zhig dag ma rnyed pa yin pas de 'phags pa ma yin ba nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But ƒÅryas do not obtain some, so it is not the case that it follows that they are not ƒÅryas.

original: de lta yin dang 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa rnam pa gnyis bstan bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa rnam pa gnyis bstan bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then the non-acquisition of the arya dharmas would be taught as twofold:

original: ma rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can dang rnyed ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can dang rnyed ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'o //
translated: that which precedes non-acquisition and that which precedes acquisition.

original: de la so so'i skye bo nyid ni ma rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can gang yin pa de yin gyi rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo nyid ni ma rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can gang yin pa de yin gyi rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: In that regard, the state of an ordinary being is that which precedes non-acquisition, not that which precedes acquisition.

original: da lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gal te rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can so so'i skye bo nyid yin par gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te rnyed pa sngon du 'gro ba can so so'i skye bo nyid yin par gyur na'o //
translated: if the state of an ordinary being were that which precedes acquisition,

original: rang gi rigs can rnams kho na rnyed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi rigs can rnams kho na rnyed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: then even a buddha would be an ordinary being, because he would acquire the dharmas of an ordinary being.üîΩIn that case, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù must be supplied,

original: 'o na ni kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra gdon dgos so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma rnyed pa kho na zhes bya bar nges te /
analyzed: 'o na ni kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra gdon dgos so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma rnyed pa kho na zhes bya bar nges te /
translated: because it is certain that the non-acquisition of the arya dharmas is only that which precedes non-acquisition.

original: de lta na ni rnyed par gyur ba na rnyed ba gang yin pa de so so'i skye bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni rnyed par gyur ba na rnyed ba gang yin pa de so so'i skye bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that were so, then it would be taught that when one obtains the fruit of stream-enterer, whatever is obtained is not the state of an ordinary being.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so.

original: gdon mi dgos so //
analyzed: gdon mi dgos so //
translated: It is not necessary.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: der nges par gzung ba ma bton yang rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: der nges par gzung ba ma bton yang rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Because even though the specification is not stated, it is understood.

original: ji ltar na ma smras par rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma smras par rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it understood without being stated?üîΩTherefore, he says,

original: de'i phyir / tshig gcig pu dag kyang zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / tshig gcig pu dag kyang zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: even a single word is understood as having a specification.

original: chu 'thung ngo //
analyzed: chu 'thung ngo //
translated: One drinks water.üîΩOne eats wind.

original: rlung za'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra med pas tshig gnyis pa med mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang 'dir chu kho na 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: rlung za'o zhes bya ba 'dir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra med pas tshig gnyis pa med mod kyi / 'on kyang 'dir chu kho na 'thung ba'o //
translated: Here, although there is no second word because the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not stated,üîΩnevertheless, the specification is understood here: ‚ÄúOne drinks only water.

original: rlung kho na za'o zhes nges par gzung ba rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung kho na za'o zhes nges par gzung ba rtogs pa yin no //
translated: One eats only wind.‚Äù

original: gal te chu yang 'thung zhing zas kyang za ba yin na ni chu 'thung ngo zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di la 'bras bu ci zhig de'i phyir chu 'thung ngo zhes bya ba nges par gzung ba khongs su bsdus pa'i phyir kho na'i sgras yang mi brjod de /
analyzed: gal te chu yang 'thung zhing zas kyang za ba yin na ni chu 'thung ngo zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di la 'bras bu ci zhig de'i phyir chu 'thung ngo zhes bya ba nges par gzung ba khongs su bsdus pa'i phyir kho na'i sgras yang mi brjod de /
translated: Therefore, because the term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is included in the expression ‚Äúdefinitely,‚Äù it does not refer to the water.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gal te 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa so so'i skye bo nyid yin na so so'i skye bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyis ma rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di la 'bras bu ci zhig yod de'i
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gal te 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa so so'i skye bo nyid yin na so so'i skye bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyis ma rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di la 'bras bu ci zhig yod de'i
translated: In the same way, if the acquisition and nonacquisition of the qualities of ƒÅryas were ordinary beings, then what would be the point of the statement ‚ÄúOrdinary beings are not the acquisition of the qualities of ƒÅryas‚Äù?

original: phyir 'di ni nges par gzung ba'i khongs su bsdus pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes @214a * //
analyzed: phyir 'di ni nges par gzung ba'i khongs su bsdus pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes @214a * //
translated: Therefore it should be understood that ‚Äúonly‚Äù is included in ‚Äúdefinitely.‚Äù

original: so ; / de'i phyir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir 'dir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra don med pa mi 'don no //
analyzed: so ; / de'i phyir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don khong du chud pa'i phyir 'dir kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra don med pa mi 'don no //
translated: Therefore, because the meaning of the term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is understood, the term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is not recited here, because it would be meaningless.

original: de bzhin du rlung ba'o zhes bya ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung ba'o zhes bya ba la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be said that the same applies to the wind element.

original: gzhan dag na re bstan pa'i nyes ba yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bstan pa'i nyes ba yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dag lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: In order to completely abandon the fault of teaching,üîΩthe nonacquisition of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering and the nonacquisition of those that arise simultaneously with it are the characteristics of an ordinary being.

analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i ma rnyed pa yin gyi /

analyzed: de las gzhan 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed ni ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams ma rnyed kyang /

analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa so so'i skye bo nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir de dag btang zhes bya brgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag btang zhes bya brgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni /

analyzed: de dag gis ma rnyed pa gtan du bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /

translated: Because one obtains perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, the nonacquisition called ‚Äúthe state of an ordinary being‚Äù and that which arises simultaneously with it are destroyed forever.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa de ni de'i rgyud la nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The nonacquisition of ƒÅrya dharmas never arises in one‚Äôs mindstream.

original: 'dir yang sngar bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang sngar bshad pa'i nyes par thal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to demonstrate the error explained previously,

original: 'o na ni de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, those also would not be abandoned by that.‚Äù

analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag go //

original: rigs gsum ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs gsum ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: and the non-obtainment of all three lineages is the same for the sravakas, etc.

original: de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the question is asked:

original: gang dag gi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhich of them are ordinary persons?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is explained:

original: thams cad kyis ma rnyed pa las so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //

translated: The remaining aggregates of that level are the karmic maturation of both.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like the special meditative absorption.

original: dper na gang dag phyogs gcig tu gyur ba na tshangs ba chen po kha cig 'khod pa'i lha de dag ni tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gang dag phyogs gcig tu gyur ba na tshangs ba chen po kha cig 'khod pa'i lha de dag ni tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the gods who are in one direction of the abode of the great Brahma are called Brahmapurohita.

original: 'dir yang 'bras bu che ba dag gi phyogs gcig na 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod do //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'bras bu che ba dag gi phyogs gcig na 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod do //
translated: In the same way, the beings devoid of ideation are in one direction of the great Brahmas.

original: gnas de ni ches mchog tu gyur pa zhig go //
analyzed: gnas de ni ches mchog tu gyur pa zhig go //
translated: This abode is the most excellent.

original: de rnams las gang gi de ris mthun par 'phangs pa dang / sems gang gis mtshams sbyar ba dang / sems gang zhig gi mjug thogs su 'du shes med ba par 'jug pa /
analyzed: de rnams las gang gi de ris mthun par 'phangs pa dang / sems gang gis mtshams sbyar ba dang / sems gang zhig gi mjug thogs su 'du shes med ba par 'jug pa /
translated: Those who are projected into this realm by the power of action, by the power of thought, by the power of concentration, are endowed with the nutriment of ideation.

original: las dang / skye ba dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis zas dang ldan pa rnams te /
analyzed: las dang / skye ba dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis zas dang ldan pa rnams te /
translated: They are endowed with the nutriment of ideation by reason of action, of birth, of the immediately preceding condition, and of the dominant condition.

original: des na de dag ni rig pa la sogs pa dag gis zas dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag ni rig pa la sogs pa dag gis zas dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus they are endowed with the nutriment of ideation by reason of the four nutriments.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la ni sngar zas zos pa las reg pa la sogs pa dag gis zas kyi bya ba byed kyi dus da ltar nya bar ston pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la ni sngar zas zos pa las reg pa la sogs pa dag gis zas kyi bya ba byed kyi dus da ltar nya bar ston pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who enter meditative attainment have food that performs the function of food through contact and so on, since they previously ate food, but not through the present time of meditative attainment.

original: sems dang bcas pa rnams la ni gnyis ka ltar yang yin no //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa rnams la ni gnyis ka ltar yang yin no //
translated: Those possessing mind have both.

original: ci de dag nam yang 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩsems med pa'i gnas skabs phal che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci de dag nam yang 'du shes can du mi 'gyur ram zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / sems med pa'i gnas skabs phal che ba'i phyir /
translated: Do they never possess discernment?

original: 'du shas med pa'i sems can rnams zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'du shas med pa'i sems can rnams zhes brjod de /
translated: They are called sentient beings devoid of discernment because they are devoid of discernment for the most part.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las sems can de dag ni 'du shes skye sa nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las sems can de dag ni 'du shes skye sa nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sentient beings devoid of discernment arise from the generation of discernment and they die and transmigrate from that state.

original: dus ring mo zhig @220a * //
analyzed: dus ring mo zhig @220a * //
translated: For a long time

original: tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig tu ma yin no //üîΩskye ba'i dus dang 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na 'du shes can du 'gyur /
analyzed: tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gcig tu ma yin no // skye ba'i dus dang 'chi 'pho ba'i dus na 'du shes can du 'gyur /
translated: means not for a single moment.üîΩThey possess discernment at the time of birth and at the time of death and transmigration.

original: shi 'pho nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi 'pho nas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are born in the desire realm after death.

original: sngon gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du byed yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩde'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du byed yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the formative factors of prior meditative attainment are exhausted.üîΩBecause the life force impelled by the mind of meditative attainment is exhausted.

original: de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe yongs su zad pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause the life force impelled by the mind of meditative attainment is exhausted.‚Äù

original: sngon med pa ma bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba med bar ni las dag nye bar sog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon med pa ma bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste / sems dang sems las byung ba med bar ni las dag nye bar sog pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not accumulated, that is, not previously collected.

original: sems pa dang bsam pa'i las zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa dang bsam pa'i las zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Karma is not accumulated without mind and mental factors because it is said that karma is intention and intentional action.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for saying ‚Äúone is born in the desire realm‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig de skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig de skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúOne who is born there‚Äù and so on.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi lhar skye ba'i las de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i khams myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi lhar skye ba'i las de bzhin du 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i khams myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The karma of beings of the northern continent Kuru to be born as a god is definite.

original: yang snyoms 'jug dag ces gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang snyoms 'jug dag ces gang bshad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, it was explained that there are two meditative attainments.

original: gang las bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang las bshad ce na /
translated: From what source is this explained?üîΩThe sutra sets forth:üîΩObtainment, nonobtainment, homogeneity,

original: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes med pa'i snyoms 'jug dag //üîΩces bstan pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes med pa'i snyoms 'jug dag // ces bstan pa'i mdo las so //
translated: and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i rgyu yin par sngar bstan pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes med pa'i rgyu yin par sngar bstan pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment was previously explained to be the cause of nondiscernment.üîΩTherefore the question is asked:

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ci zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment?

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni pa ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bshad la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni pa ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bshad la /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is like the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

original: ji ltar gang las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de la 'du shes med pa pa zhes bshad ba ;
analyzed: ji ltar gang las sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de la 'du shes med pa pa zhes bshad ba ;
translated: Just as it was explained that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the cause of nondiscernment,

original: de bzhin 'du shes med snyoms 'jug //
analyzed: de bzhin 'du shes med snyoms 'jug //
translated: So too, the attainment of nonperception.

original: 'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du shes pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The attainment of nonperception is the attainment of those who are without ideation.

original: gang dag der snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩ'du shes med pa can yin pas zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang sbyar te /üîΩ'di la @220b 'du shes yod pa ma yin pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag der snyoms par 'jug pa'o // 'du shes med pa can yin pas zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang sbyar te / 'di la @220b 'du shes yod pa ma yin pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who enter into it are called ‚Äúthose who are without ideation.üîΩ‚Äù The attainment of those who are without ideation is called ‚Äúthe attainment of nonideation.üîΩ‚Äù It is called ‚Äúthe attainment of nonideation‚Äù because there is no ideation in it.

original: yang dag pa dang te por snyoms par zhugs pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang te por snyoms par zhugs pas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúthe attainment of nonideation‚Äù because it is entered into by a person who is without ideation.

original: rigs yang dag par sgrub pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rigs yang dag par sgrub pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the establishment of the class is the attainment.

original: gzhan dag na re sems dang 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pas na snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems dang 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pas na snyoms par 'jug pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is called ‚Äúattainment‚Äù because it establishes the equality of the mind and the great elements.

original: sems dang sems las byung pa thams cad 'gog pa la yang sa dzny'a dve sha na de bskyed pa'i phyir 'du shes can gyi snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung pa thams cad 'gog pa la yang sa dzny'a dve sha na de bskyed pa'i phyir 'du shes can gyi snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is called the meditative attainment of nondiscernment because it generates the cessation of all minds and mental factors.

original: na hi n'o rla be n'a dre sh'i tanggarpa de bas m'a pitta pra pe sh'ata de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de tsam zhig mthun par 'dren to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spyir ma zhig kho na mthun par ('du shes maüîΩstong pas/) 'dren gyi /
analyzed: na hi n'o rla be n'a dre sh'i tanggarpa de bas m'a pitta pra pe sh'ata de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de tsam zhig mthun par 'dren to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni spyir ma zhig kho na mthun par ('du shes ma stong pas/) 'dren gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúthus‚Äù in the root text indicates that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is similar to the meditative attainment of nondiscernment in terms of the mere fact that it is a meditative attainment that is a cessation of minds and mental factors.üîΩIt does not indicate that it is similar in all aspects.

original: khyad par ni ma yin no zhes ston (med min 'phags pa tshor ba stong pa ngas snyoms lnga snyoms pa 'jug pa la zhugs pas so //üîΩ) par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni ma yin no zhes ston (med min 'phags pa tshor ba stong pa ngas snyoms lnga snyoms pa 'jug pa la zhugs pas so // ) par byed pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is a meditative attainment that is a cessation of minds and mental factors.üîΩIt is called the meditative attainment of nondiscernment because it is a meditative attainment that is a cessation of minds and mental factors.

original: gnyi ga yang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i gegs kyi bdag nyid du mtshungs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i gegs kyi bdag nyid du mtshungs te /
translated: Both are similar in that they are the obstruction of future minds and mental factors.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyir skyon med do //
translated: Therefore there is no error.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The meditative attainment of nonperception is called the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: bsam gtan tha mar zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan tha mar zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The fourth meditative absorption is to be supplied.

original: rgyu cis 'du shes med pa pa 'bras bu che ba rnams su rnam par smin pa zhes bshad /
analyzed: rgyu cis 'du shes med pa pa 'bras bu che ba rnams su rnam par smin pa zhes bshad /
translated: Why is the meditative attainment of nonperception called the result of the great result?

original: 'bras bu che ba ni bsam gtan bzhi bar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba ni bsam gtan bzhi bar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great result is the fourth meditative absorption.üîΩWhy is it not the result of others?

original: de rgyu cis gzhan gyis par 'gyur zhe na ma bshad pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de rgyu cis gzhan gyis par 'gyur zhe na ma bshad pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error because it is not explained.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du shes med pa ba'i rgyur 'ga' zhig gis bshad pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'du shes med pa ba'i rgyur 'ga' zhig gis bshad pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: Some explain that the meditative attainment of nonperception is the cause of the state of nonperception, but that is not so.

original: 'di rnam par smin pa zhes mdo las bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rnam par smin pa zhes mdo las bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't it explained in the sutras that this is karmic maturation?

original: 'ga' zhig ni bsten bcos su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni bsten bcos su yang ma yin te /
translated: Some say that it is not karmic maturation because it is not explained in the treatise.

original: 'dir mdor byas pa nyid kyis de grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mdor byas pa nyid kyis de grub pa'o //
translated: But it is established here because it is included in the summary.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa smos pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i sa ba nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa smos pa ni de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i sa ba nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth meditative absorption is mentioned in order to eliminate the other meditative absorptions and formless states.

original: so so skye bo rnams ni tsho rab la chags pas bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la snyoms par 'jug na /
analyzed: so so skye bo rnams ni tsho rab la chags pas bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag la snyoms par 'jug na /
translated: Ordinary beings are attached to the pleasure of meditative concentration, and so they enter meditative attainment in the form and formless realms.

original: de na ni tshor ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de na ni tshor ba yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: But since there is no feeling there, the question is asked:

original: ci'i phyir / 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce @221a * //üîΩna zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir / 'di la snyoms par 'jug ce @221a * // na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why do they enter meditative attainment there?

original: 'byung 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung 'dod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they desire to be born there.

original: de dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa lam du 'du shes shing /
analyzed: de dag ni snyoms par 'jug pa lam du 'du shes shing /
translated: They perceive meditative attainment as the path and

original: 'du shes med pa la thar par 'du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la thar par 'du shes pa yin no //
translated: they perceive the state of non-perception as liberation.

original: 'di ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba ste /
translated: This is wholesome.

original: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dge ba nyid du ma bshad kyang grub po //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir dge ba nyid du ma bshad kyang grub po //
translated: Even though it is not stated that it is wholesome because it is the cause of karmic maturation, it is established as wholesome.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi nang du phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can gyi nang du phung po lnga'o //
translated: Its karmic maturation is the five aggregates in the realm of beings devoid of ideation.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not defiled or neutral,

original: 'di las bzlog pa nges par gzung ba de'i tshe brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa nges par gzung ba de'i tshe brjod par bya'o //
translated: but rather the opposite of that.

original: med par yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di so so'i skye bor bshad do //üîΩaa ramtha ta /
analyzed: med par yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di so so'i skye bor bshad do // aa ramtha ta /
translated: The term ‚Äúordinary person‚Äù is explained in this way.

original: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes nas myong 'gyur nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto be experienced after rebirth‚Äù means

original: de thob pa yongs su nyams pa na bdag nyid thar pa las yongs su nyams par sems shing skyo ba drag po 'byung ste /
analyzed: de thob pa yongs su nyams pa na bdag nyid thar pa las yongs su nyams par sems shing skyo ba drag po 'byung ste /
translated: that when one regresses from the attainment of this state, one feels that one has regressed from liberation and one feels great sorrow.

original: de'i phyir de bskyed pa kho na la gus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dul bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bskyed pa kho na la gus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dul bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, one does not become a disciple of the Buddha, because one generates this state and then regresses from it.

original: (brtsam pa'i phyir ro/) /'gog pa mngon sum du mthong bar rlom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: (brtsam pa'i phyir ro/) /'gog pa mngon sum du mthong bar rlom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is arrogant because one thinks that one has directly perceived cessation.üîΩTherefore, the text says,

original: de'i phyir / gang gis 'di bskyed nas yongs su nyams pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang gis 'di bskyed nas yongs su nyams pa de yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who generates this state and then regresses from it is also called an ordinary person.‚Äù

original: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lugs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re /
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba'i sgra ni lugs gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro // gzhan dag na re /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that there is another opinion.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang myong bar nges pa'i yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang myong bar nges pa'i yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that one who is destined to experience the result of action in the next life and one who is destined to experience the result of action at some time is also an ordinary person.

original: yongs su nyams sam yongs su ma nyams kyang rung ste gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa las skyon du lta bar 'gyur na ni de nas nges pa la 'jug par 'gyur la /

translated: Whether or not they have completely degenerated, if they view the faults of meeting with a spiritual teacher, then they enter into certainty.

original: zhugs pa na yang bskyed par mi byed cing mngon du yang mi byed do //
analyzed: zhugs pa na yang bskyed par mi byed cing mngon du yang mi byed do //
translated: And having entered, they do not generate it and do not manifest it.

original: rgyu cis so so skye bo kun tu spyod pa las nyams nas snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu cis so so skye bo kun tu spyod pa las nyams nas snyoms par 'jug pa dang mi ldan zhe na /
translated: Why do ordinary beings degenerate from the practice of meditative attainment?

original: de yang chos 'di dang chos gzhan ci yang rung ba so so skye bo'i kho na yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de yang chos 'di dang chos gzhan ci yang rung ba so so skye bo'i kho na yin par 'dod kyi /

original: 'phags pa'i ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ma yin zhes bya ste /

original: 'phags pa rnams ni nges pa la zhugs pa nyid kyis ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang 'du shes med pa pa dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni nges pa la zhugs pa nyid kyis ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang 'du shes med pa pa dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa 'thob ste /
